loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, timber, nails and posts for making a shelter for keeping his burnt bricks to avoid them from being rained on and be destroyed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as engines, tyres, wheel rings and wheel boosters for repair and maintenance so as to enable him offer better transport services to clients.

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cheryll works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Cheryll is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Cheryll has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. 

Elvira is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sahak

texts.en:
Sahak runs a farm which was enriched through his hard and tireless work over the years. Sahak keeps livestock and also cultivates land. It gives him an opportunity to sell some vegetables, crops, meat and cheese that he makes with his wife. This brings not a lot but nevertheless some income to the family. Sahak is married and lives with his wife, son, and parents. There are a lot of financial needs in this family and all family members work hard to handle difficulties. 

Sahak asks for this loan of USD 800 to purchase forage for feeding his livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation. Sahak's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living. Shirak is considered to be a poor region, with a high unemployment rate, and low living standards. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs makes a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in the Shirak region. Sahak thanks his Kiva lenders and anticipates their support.

He is sure that working with Kiva lenders will be productive and profitable.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding his livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina is a KIVA borrower who is willing to work on her farm. She is a 39-year-old smallholder farmer based in Nkubu, which is a small rural town in Central Kenya. Penina and her husband have been blessed with two children. For 15 years, Penina has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows different varieties of crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. Penina, however, is taking this a little step further. She is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like spices, meat, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Elvira has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like spices, meat, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flowers to sell and other varieties of ornamental plants

loans.name: Mombasa Group

texts.en: Eva was born in 1957. She is married and has seven children. She has run a poultry business for 5 years now. Her business is doing well and she is able to care for her family. She works from 6 am to 11 pm per working day and is able to make a good return per month. This is her 4th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania and she has been paid successfully. The previous loans she used to purchase feed and broilers. She will invest this loan to buy broilers and feed again. She will share this loan with her group "Mombasa" which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy broilers and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, timber, nails and posts for making a shelter for keeping his burnt bricks to avoid them from being rained on and be destroyed.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
50-year-old Joseph has never stepped foot at any higher education school, but he is an accomplished farmer from the Bomet area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. He is happily married and, together with his beautiful wife, is blessed with three children. 

For the past eight years he has been involved in mixed farming and because of the immense knowledge he has on farming, farmers from his village and neighboring villages troop to his home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. 

His primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and some personal businesses he engages in to make extra income. Joseph sells poultry to his neighbors and to the local market to make more money. His work is not without challenges he says, though he is regarded as the best poultry farmer in his village. He has been unable to meet the market demand, which has resulted in a loss of tenders. One of his neighbors ordered 100 crates of eggs which he was unable to supply. 

He is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry so that he can satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance business that supports small scale farmers, Joseph is confident that this loan will permanently change his life. 

Increased profit from poultry selling will allow him to afford his highest monthly expenses - farm-related comforts and the ability to channel a surplus amount to his children's education. 

Joseph is a visionary and plans that through increased profits, he will be able to start a large shop for selling eggs and poultry meat.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 30 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling business for Tupperware products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like lotion, powder, etc. to sell.

Juliet has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business for Tupperware products for 9 years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like lotion, powder, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 31 years old, married, and supports a family of two children. He has been operating his retail shop for the last 11 years earning KES13,000 per month. 


Daniel has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area to gain more income. 


He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area to gain more income.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is 54 years old and married with three children.

He works hard to provide for his family. He runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Edgardo has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling herbal medicine.

Edgardo aspires to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, softdrinks, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. 

Luzminda dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Loria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, three of whom are in school, Ma. Loria works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas. Ma. Loria is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell in her buy and sell rice grains business.

Ma. Loria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old and single.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her buy and sell rice business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Thùy

texts.en: Thùy is 33 years old and married. She lives in Hoang Hoa District, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general items for five years. Her family is a low-income household in the village. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the unhygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. In 2012, Thùy joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thùy has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to build a toilet.

loans.name: Dancun

texts.en:
Dancun is an ever-smiling farmer even if he is faced with adversity.Two years ago, Dancun started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Githu, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, this humble single man sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. He is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge he has about farming, he commands a lot of respect from other farmers in his village. Dairy farming is close to his heart; every day he wakes up to milk his cow and that makes him very proud. Although he makes profits through milk selling, he lacks a proper dairy unit and he is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan he will have a humble time milking his cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Dancun believes that through this loan his living conditions will change because he is going to have an increase in milk production. He will save the money that he used to spend on treating his cows because he lacked a good dairy unit. 

Lenders, if there is someone that you should consider lending to then that person is Dancun.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 42 años de edad de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material adobe, junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el caserío Laynas del Distrito de la Matanza, Provincia Morropón, Región Piura, Costa norte de Perú es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura , ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz.

La actividad que desarrolla junto a su cónyuge es la preparación y venta de chicha de jora los dias domingo y lunes, actividad que realiza hace más de 15 años, siendo muy conocidos en la zona y teniendo clientela fija. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en la compra de maíz y otros insumos como azúcar , leña, para la producción de la chicha, la compra le ayudará tener mayores niveles de producción con mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 42 years old and in a common-law marriage. He lives in his own house made of adobe together with his spouse and children in the small village of Laynas in the Matanza District, [located in the] Morropón Province [in the] Piura Region. The northern coast of Peru is a place where habitants work in agriculture and ranching. Businesses have basic services like water and light. 

The work that he has built up together with his spouse is the preparation and sale of traditional corn liquor on Sundays and Mondays. It is work that he has done for more than 15 years, being very well-known in the area and having a steady customer base. The use of the loan will be to invest it in the purchase of corn and other supplies like sugar and firewood for the production of the liquor. The purchase will help him to have better production levels with a better income, which will allow them to better their quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies for the preparation of traditional corn liquor.

loans.name: Thi

texts.en: Thi is 41 years old and married. He lives in Hoang Hoa District, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. He has worked in farming for more than 10 years. His family is a low-income household in the village. One of his most critical difficulties is the unhygienic sanitation where his family lives. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. In 2015, Thi joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve his  business. He has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to build a toilet.

loans.name: Zancoura

texts.fr: Zancoura  est agriculteur inscrit à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Zelabougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Âgé de 65 ans, Zancoura est le père de 11 enfants âgés de 3 mois à 33 ans, et dont l'1 d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L'amour de l'agriculture, mais aussi avec le courage ont incité Zancoura à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive l'arachide, le maïs, le mil, le sorgho  et le coton sur sa parcelle de 15 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour cultiver avec un instrument plus efficace. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'être rapide et moins fatigué. Zancoura espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille et acheter des motos pour mes enfants.
texts.en:
Zancoura is a farmer and a member of myAgro. He lives and works in the village of Zelabougou in the southeast of Bamako in Mali. He is 65 years old and has 11 children ranging from three months to 33 years of age, one of whom is currently attending school. Zancoura decided to become a farmer because he liked this work and felt ready to tackle it. He grows peanuts, corn, millet, sorghum and cotton on his field of 15 ha [37 acres], facing challenges such as droughts. 

This year  Zancoura's wish is to buy a seeder in order to be able to work his land with a more efficient tool. Having a seeder will allow him to work faster  and get less tired. With the increase of his yield and his revenues, Zancoura hopes to ensure a constant food supply for his family and buy motorbikes for his children.

loans.use: to buy a precision seeder.

loans.name: Amjad’S Group

texts.en: Amjad lives in K.N Shah, a native village in Gujranwala, Pakistan. He is standing in the middle in the group photo. He grows rice and wheat to feed his family. He lacks financial resources to procure required agricultural inputs; therefore, he and his group members are requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs like fertilizer, pesticides, improved seeds, and fuel to grow their rice. This loan will enable them to improve the yield of their rice crop. They are committed to repay the loan per the loan schedule.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina es una mujer de 47 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 16 y 22 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez. Aquilina para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, con este negocio lleva ella 4 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también cuenta con una tortillería. Aquilina con el afán de prosperar ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para ampliar su tienda de abarrotes y poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes con el crédito ella comprara productos como golosina, azúcar, arroz y gaseosas.
El gran sueño de Aquilina es que su tienda crezca y mejore sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Aquilina is a 47 year old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family of three children between the ages of 16 and 22. This humble family lives in a community in Suchitepéquez. To earn an income and move her family forward, Aquilina works buying and selling groceries. She has had this business for 4 years, but to better her income she also has a tortilla making business.

Aquilina, with the eagerness to prosper, has made the decision to request a loan to expand her grocery store and to be able to better satisfy the needs of the customers. With the loan she will buy products like candy, sugar, rice, and soft drinks. 

Aquilina's great dream is that her store grows and she improves her income.

loans.use: to buy products like candy, sugar, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en: Sem’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sem makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
Junalyn is encouraged that she received a loan of 11,000 PHP to pay for the needed maintenance of her tricycle unit. No matter how hard life is in a third world country, Junalyn keeps her faith that with her and her husband's perseverance and God's grace they will be able to overcome the challenges in life.  

She is again humbly requesting a 15,000 PHP loan for the regular maintenance of her tricycle unit. It is really important that her tricycle is always in a good running condition to ensure safe and efficient service. This will in turn ensure a consistent income which will surely help cover their daily sustenance and fund her children's school requirements. 

Junalyn's precious dream is to see all her three children finish school. She prays for God's traveling mercies for her husband as he does his tricycle service. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

texts.en:
Thun’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Speu province in Cambodia. Thun makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a tailor and factory laborer to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking female entrepreneur with five children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods and personal care products.

Josefina industriously earns additional income through other business ventures including raising pigs and farming rice. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Josefina dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods and personal care products

loans.name: Leak's Group

texts.en:
A resident of the Snoul district of Kratie province, Leak is 20 years old, married, and the mother of one child who is not yet school-aged. Her main source of income for the past six years has been growing cassava. To earn additional income, she works for others for a fee. 

Currently, Leak's crops are threatened by pests, and this is the main challenge she faces. As she needs more capital to save the business, she is leading a group of five members to take out a new loan. This is the second time she has borrowed from VisionFund. Her previous loan has been repaid completely. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizers to enhance crop production. 

She hopes to earn more income to support her family’s needs and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizers to enhance crop production.

loans.name: Thern's Group

texts.en:
Thern’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Speu province in Cambodia. Thern makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and seller by selling groceries to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and this woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Marim's Group

texts.en:
Marim’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Marim makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: The members of Sarin’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sarin makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is wholeheartedly thanking you for the support she received to sustain her poultry and ducks business. Her two college, two high school and one elementary children motivate her and her husband more to continue to do their best in providing for their children's needs and support them in their studies. Aside from her poultry business, as shown in her current photo, she is also a jeepney operator, which her husband drives as a transportation service in their town.

She trusts that she can avail herself  of a PHP 30,000 loan to pay for the registration, fuel and changing the oil of her jeepney. It is very important to regularly maintain her jeepney to ensure safe and efficient service. Negligence to properly maintain her jeepney will disrupt its service and in turn affect their means of income. She thanks God and you for your good heart as you assist her in their livelihood.

Ma. Theresa dreams for her poultry farm and transportation service to grow. She desires for all her children to get a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the registration and fuel and change the oil of her jeepney.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her business.

Analiza has been in this business for 2 years and earns additional income from fishing. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from tailoring.  Mary Grace is borrowing 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase a fishing net for her fishing business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Honorio

texts.en:
Honorio is happy and thankful that he was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which helped produce a harvest on his pineapple farm. Living in an agricultural country, he takes advantage of the good weather and fertile soil at Silang, Cavite. His proceeds from his farm helped support his family and meet their daily basic needs.

He hopes to avail himself of an another 20,000 PHP loan, which he will use to maintain his farm and buy more fertilizer for a productive pineapple harvest. Unfortunately, his farm produce suffered when his country was hit by the recent typhoon. Despite some loss, Honorio keeps his positive outlook and faith that God will see them through to provide for their needs. He is thanking you for your good heart for supporting his livelihood.

Honorio's precious dream is to have a consistently productive harvest, and he prays for God's abundance in their lives. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and maintenance of his pineapple farm.

loans.name: Edisson

texts.es:
El socio Edison se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta y compra de vehiculos nuevos,el socio es una persona trabajadora y emrpendedora que por medio de este negocio el socio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es ampliar su negocio de venta y compra de vehiculos.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas y motores.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Edisson continues to work in the business of buying and selling new cars. This member of the communal bank is a hardworking and enterprising person who, via this business, wants to support his family. His dream is to expand his business of buying and selling cars. He is applying for the loan to buy tires and engines. 

He is happy about the loan and promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: buy tires and engines.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La socia Lilian  se dedica al negocio de venta de cereales, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Lilian works selling cereals. She is a hardworking woman who supports her family through this business. She is requesting a loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa. Lilian is happy for this loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, nails and pins.

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Sabitri lives in tha small village of Ruidanga in Falakata. Together they are raising two childred (one son and one daughter). Sabitri's 22-year-old son studied up to grade 10 and now he is engaged in some income-generating jobs. Sabitri's husband is a farmer. He has been growing vegetables and sellng in the village market. Though his income is scanty, he is striving hard to provide an education for his only daughter.

Ratna, Sabitri's only daughter is 25 years old and pursuing her Bachelor of Arts from Falakata College. She cherished a dream since her childhood to become a teacher and teach the poor village children. To fulfill her dream, she strives hard to complete her graduation, securing good marks. Both Sabitri and her husband have great expectations for their only daughter. They expect she will achieve high educational qualifications to compete with progressive people in social status. But they can't afford the huge educational expenses of their daughter.

Hence, Sabitri is requesting a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to bear the educational expenses of her daughter. She plans to pay college fees, buy study materials and engage private tutors for her daughter. The loan will help this bright young girl continue her education without any obstacles.

Sabitri and Ratna (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's educational expenses.

loans.name: Rhea Mae

texts.en:
As a single parent of five children, Rhea Mae works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Rhea Mae is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Rhea Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

Aireen has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Thoeub's Group

texts.en:
Thoeub is a 54-year-old farmer living in a remote area of the Battambang province. She has six children. To support her living, she works in fishing in order to earn her main income. In her spare time, she works for others for a fee in order to earn additional income. These two businesses earn her a decent income and she has been involved in them for 12 years. Moreover, she is able to save around 18,000 KHR each day after offsetting her business expenses. Not catching any fish is the main challenge for her business.

Thoeub has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles already and completely repaid her past loans. As the group leader of two members, she will manage her loan portion to buy a boat and fishing materials to support her lifestyle. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income to expand her current business and improve her living standard so it is much better than before.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishing materials to support her lifestyle.

loans.name: Johann

texts.en:
Johann works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Johann is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for fishing like gasoline, nets, etc for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Johann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for fishing like gasoline and nets

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Nerissa has been in this business for 7 years. She earns more income from a side business selling dried fish as well.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 19 years old, single and works hard to help her parents.

She has a peanut vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store she runs.  Monaliza is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell for her business.

Monaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cherry works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables herself.  Cherry is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Thok's Group

texts.en: Thok, who is a 42-year-old farmer, lives in Phnom Proek district of Battambang province and she is a married mother of two dependent children who are in school and need better support for their studies. Selling grocery items has been her main business for ten years already. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee to supplement income. These days, a lack of capital to buy more grocery items to resell is the main challenge she is facing. She decided to lead a group of two to apply for a new loan. This will be her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan successfully. The previous loan allowed her to renovate her house and to provide her children with enough healthy food. As a group leader, she will use her loan to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to earn more income to upgrade her living standard much better than before.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo de periodita deportivo,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su familia.El socio solcita el credito para comprar un telvisor para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working at his job as a sports journalist. He works from 8am until 5pm. Through this work, the borrower is able to help his family to move forward. He is applying for a loan in order to buy a television for his house.

The borrower is happy with this loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: to buy a television for his house.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: Vanny, 61 years old, is living in Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of five dependent children. In order to support her living conditions, she has been catching fish as the main source of her family income for 43 years. She is able to save about 19,000 KHR each day after her expenses. She has a lot of competition from other sellers and that is the problem for her business. She is the leader of a group of two members and will take her first loan of 1,000,000 KHR while another member is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy a trough for raising fish via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy a trough for raising fish

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Manos Juntas De Rumichaca Alta Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MANOS JUNTAS DE RUMICHACA ALTA.
La socia Nilda tiene 48 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diaria dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales entre otros.
Los socios en general se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia que sale adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Nilda belongs to the "Manos Juntas de Rumchaca Alta" loan group.

Nilda is 48 years old and has four children. She has a partner. Nilda alternates her daily activities with a business raising small animals. Nilda has had her business for some time, and it is going well thanks to her determination at work every day. Nilda wants to be able to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family.

Nilda is applying for a loan in order to buy animals and more.

The group members are grateful for this loan and promise to make their repayments.

The group member in the separate photo had advised that she would be late for the meeting owing to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy animals and more.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, Rom is 48 years old and a married father of two children. To make a living, he grows cassava as the main source of income. He sometimes works for others for a fee to earn additional income.

Because he needs more capital to upgrade his business, he leads a group of two members to take out a new loan. This will be his fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his past loan. The past loan has enabled him to provide sufficient food for his family members and renovate the house much better. With this new loan, he will pay for the fee of plowing the field and labor and to buy cassava seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to earn more income to improve his living standard so it is much better.

loans.use: to pay the fee for plowing the field and labor and to buy cassava seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to repair the roof of the lean-to.

loans.name: Femirose

texts.en:
Femirose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

Femirose has been in this business for one year. Femirose earns more income from her general store, raising pigs and fishing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Femirose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia Eulogia se sigue dedicando al negocio de alquiler de carros, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es comprar un carro nuevo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para sus carros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eulogia still runs a car rental service. She works from 8 am to 6 pm.
She has been engaged in this activity for several years and it has been going very well.
Her dream is to buy a new car.
She is applying for the loan to buy tires for her rental fleet.
She is happy with the loan and promises to be punctual in her repayments.

loans.use: to buy tires for her rental fleet.

loans.name: Raquel Eudocia

texts.es:
La socia Raquel se sigue dedicando al trabajo como odontologa,la socia es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su famiiia.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una instrumentos de trabajo como una silla odontológica y masillas para los dientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Raquel is still working as a dentist.
She is very hard-working, and her practice is her family's main source of income.
She asks for the loan to buy the tools she needs to work, such as a dentist's chair and dental prosthetics.
She is happy with the loan and promises to be punctual in her repayments.

loans.use: to buy tools for her dentistry practice.

loans.name: Naileen

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Naileen works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Naileen is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Naileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Volak

texts.en:
Volak is a 20-year-old student who lives with her widowed mother, a rice farmer, in the Kratie province in Cambodia. Currently, Volak is studying the third year of a bachelor’s degree and also working for a bank as a teller, making USD 6.67 each day. 

She does not have enough money to cover her university fees this year so she needs a loan. She will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree with specific skills with this loan. In the future, she hopes to have a better job and save money to run her own business.

loans.use: to cover her third year university fees.

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Omary, who is in his early 50s, is married with six children. Five of the kids are still at school and one is grown-up. He has been selling seasonal fruits in Dar es Salaam. November to March is the season for mangoes and pineapples, and June and July is for oranges and melons. Omary is selling plenty of mangoes, both wholesale and retail. He has been in this business for five years now. He works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

Omary has taken several loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy fruits according to the season. He has successfully paid back all his loans and is doing great with the loan. He appreciates Kiva for supporting their group. He used the profit to build his house, pay school fees and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy various fruits to sell. He dreams of renovating his house to be up to standard and to get a good rent from it.

Omary will share this loan with his loan group which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy various fruits to sell.

loans.name: Bunda Friend Grp Group

texts.en:
Selemani is a father of one son who is in school. Selemani is in his early thirties. For six years now, his bread generating work has been a shop selling clothes and shoes. He works from 07am to 07pm each working day and has the ability to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is his second credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Friend, a four-member group. Selemani used the previous credit which was a great support to his business and bought new stocks of clothes. 

He managed to repay successfully the previous loan and with the small profit earned, supported his family with needs (school fees and food). He currently rents his house, but believes that in the coming years, he will build a nice family house, grow his business and improve his family life. 

Because of the great effort this group has made with their previous loan, Tujijenge requests Kiva to support a second credit to the Friend group. 

With this credit, he will invest to buy a new stock of clothes to resell. Selemani and his three friend will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Jomratia

texts.en:
Jomratia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children, two of whom are in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, personal care products, etc. .

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs and buying and selling bamboo.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jomratia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, personal care products.

loans.name: Jagannath Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Rama, aged 43 years is the featured borrower of Jagannath SHG-E. She is from the village of Ramgiri in Koraput district. She is the one standing on the left hand side in the photo. 

Rama is a married woman and the mother of four children. Her husband works as a hawker. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all of their household expenses, so she started her milk sales business. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

Along with her group member, she has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Rama will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase another cow to increase her sales and earn profits so she can provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

Rama aspires to add value to her dairy business and start selling paneer, cheese and curd which will increase her margin of profit by increasing her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maa Bhabani Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Sebati aged 27 of Ramagiri village of Koraput district is the featured borrower of Maa Bhabani SHG- A. She is the one standing to the right in the photo. Sebati lives with her husband and three children. Her husband drives a tractor on the farm land. 

For additional income, Sebati deals with betel nuts (a kind of mouth freshener used in rural areas of India). As they have no betel nut trees, she has to purchase raw betel nuts from her own villagers and from the neighbouring villages. Then, removing the shells, she cuts the sun-dried betel nuts into small pieces to sell to the retailers. She wants to give her family financial stability; that is why she needs capital to expand her existing business.

Along with her group member, she has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Sebati will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase more raw betel nuts in order to enhance her sales and earn a comparatively higher amount of profits.

Sebati aspires to purchase two cows and start her milk business and through her earnings she will be building a new house for her and her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more raw betel nuts in order to enhance her sales.

loans.name: N4Kp3Psơn-Hard Working For A Better Life Group

texts.en:
Nụ lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has operated a food stall selling beef for five years. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the job is unstable. 

The main hardship that Nụ faces is lack of capital. She has no collateral because she cannot get a loan from other banks or financial institutions, but she is a reputable person in the community. Nụ and four other women established the loan group "N4KP3PSơn-Hard working for a better life" to get a loan and share experiences in doing business.

In 2014, Nụ joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Nụ has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, and is requesting a second loan to purchase more beef to resell.

With her business profit, Nụ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more beef to resell.

loans.name: Ghulam’S Group

texts.en:
Ghulam is 39 years old and has three children. He lives in the village Mari Bhindran, located in the Punjab province in Pakistan. 

Ghulam earns income to support his family by growing rice and wheat. He is leading a group of three to take a loan from Kiva. As the group leader, he will use his loan portion to buy input supplies such as pesticide, seeds and fertilizer, and pay a fee for land preparation. He expects his rice plantation to give greater yields, increasing his ability to expand his farming.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Imtiaz’S Group

texts.en:
Imtiaz is a farmer. He is standing in the middle of the group photo, raising his hand and holding a booklet. He lives in the village K.N Shah, located in the Punjab province in Pakistan.

He and his group members grow wheat and rice to earn their livelihood. They lack financial resources to buy agricultural inputs including seed, fertilizers, pesticides and fuel when they need them. They end up utilizing fewer and substandard inputs, resulting in low crop yields. 

They ask for a loan to purchase adequate agricultural inputs. This loan will help them to sell their rice crop in the open market and gain more revenue, enabling them to support their families better. They are committed to repaying the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling herbal medicines in the Philippines. Mercedita has been in this business for two years now.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional box of herbal medicine to sell. In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Nayra Andrea

texts.es:
La socia Nayra Andrea  se sigue dedica al trabajo como odontologa,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales odontologicas como instrumentos,resinas y amalgamas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Nayra Andrea, continues to be dedicated to the work of odontology. She is an enterprising and hard working woman who, through this business, wants to succeed. The member is requesting the loan to buy odontological materials like instruments, resins and amalgam.

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy odontological materials like instruments, resins and amalgam.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia Yanet se dedica al trabajo como profesora, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yanet is dedicated to working as a professor. She works from 8AM until 2PM. Through this work, she wants to succeed. This member's dream is to have a shop selling clothing. She is requesting a loan to buy stereo equipment for her house. The member is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy stereo equipment for her house.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is from Dalar village, where she lives with her husband and 11-year-old son. Lusine has been running her farm for 20 years. She is specialized in poultry and currently keeps 20 chickens and 30 turkeys. 

Lusine is sure that working with Kiva lenders will be productive and profitable, so has applied for this loan. She plans to pay for the renovation of her greenhouse, fertilizer, seeds for land cultivation and farm labour. 

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Lusine get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Lusine hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, fertilizer, seeds and labour.

loans.name: N1Th3Hà Yên-Meek Women Group

texts.en:
Mây is 33 years old and she is married. She lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
 
She has had a retail business selling electronics for more than 10 years. However, her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Mây faces is lack of capital. In 2015, Mây joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She is reputable in the community, and all members agreed to vote her to be the group leader of "N1Th3Hà Yên-Meek women" group.

Mây has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drink to resell. With her business profit, Mây hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation internationally.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drink to resell.

loans.name: Muhammad’S Group

texts.en:
Muhammad, 34 years old, did not have the opportunity to go to school. He is the group leader raising his hand in the photo, holding a booklet. He works in agriculture to earn the livelihood for his family. He is the resident of a village named Mari Bhindran located in the Punjab province in Pakistan. 

He has been working in the business of agriculture since he was 18 years old, a job he learned from his parents. He works in this business because it was the most viable way to get income. 

He and his group members are requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides, seeds and fuel for their rice crop. This loan will help them to increase their farm productivity.

His dream is to have a brick house and he hopes to manage it with work and dedication.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: N5Kp8Ba Đình- Loans Change Our Life Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nụ is 52 years old and married. She lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
 
She has had a retail business selling dry goods and general items such as cakes, sweets, sugar and milk for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need for her business is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Nụ faces is lack of capital. In 2014, Nụ joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Nụ and four other women established the loan group "N5KP8Ba Đình- Loans change our life" to get loan and share experience to do business for a better life. Nụ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is a reputable person in the community. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell. With her business profit, Nụ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell.

loans.name: Katherine Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Katherine Roxana se dedica al negocio de prestar servicios de publicidad a diferentes empresas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Katherine Roxana earns a living by offering advertising services to various businesses. She is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman, who improves her family's financial situation with her work.

She is requesting this loan to buy audio equipment for her home.

She is happy about the loan and committed to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a audio equipment for her home.

loans.name: Señor De Accha Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE ACCHA.
La socia Jesusa tiene 30 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual el va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Senor de Accha community bank. Jesusa is 30 years old, is married and has two children. She alternates her daily work dedicating herself to selling clothing. The member is having a good time with her business which is going well thanks to the effort she puts forth every day. She wishes to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting her family.

The member has requested the loan to buy sweaters, among other items. The members, in general, are thankful for the loan granted and promise to make her payments. The member in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work.

loans.use: to buy sweaters among other items.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales uno va a la escuela y los demás ya están acompañados y en su casa solo vive su pareja, una hija y un nieto.

Deysi, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 16 años de edad, su padre fue quien le enseño este oficio y desde que se acompañó le ayuda a su pareja a trabajar a la agricultura y el lugar donde cultivan está a una distancia de 10 minutos caminando. 

Deysi, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como pesticidas y 6 sacos de abono, esto le ayudará mucho para que su milpa crezca fuerte y sea una buena producción.
  
El sueño de Deysi, es ayudar a su hija para que se prepare académicamente y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Deysi is 43 years old and went to school until sixth grade. She is in a relationship and her partner is earning a living in agriculture. She has five children. One of them goes to school and the others are in relationships. She lives in her house only with her partner, one daughter and one grandchild.

Deysi has been working in agriculture since she was 16 years old. Her father showed her the trade and ever since she has been together with her partner, she has been helping him with his agricultural work. The site they are cultivating is a 10 minute walk away.

Deysi needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies like pesticides and six bags of fertilizer. This will help her cornfield to grow strongly and have a good harvest.

Deysi's wish is to help her daughter so she can get an academic education and be a professional.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like pesticides and six bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya is a 46-year-old housewife who lives in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband and her children. Her two daughters got married and two children (one son and one daughter) are studying in different grades.

Her son, Indrajit, reads in grade 12 at Bairatiguri High School. He is an intelligent student and scores well in his exams in spite of his adverse situation at home. 

His father has a small business of making clay idols. Since it is a seasonal business, his family struggles to make ends meet every year when it's time to pay for his educational expenses, including his school fees, uniform, books and other necessities. 

But his good performances in school examinations inspires Sandhya to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for his uninterrupted schooling. Sandhya will use the loan amount to pay for her son’s school and private tuition fees and she will also buy necessary educational articles for her son. 

The loan will help this bright young boy continue his education without any obstacles. Now Sandhya and her son Indrajit (as in the picture) are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding the educational loan.

loans.use: To bear her son's education-related expenses for uninterrupted education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, and sand to cement the floor of her housing.

loans.name: Maa Bhabani Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Premasila is a hardworking woman of 36 years from Ramagiri village of Koraput district. The lady standing to the left is Premasila. She is married and a mother of two children (a son and a daughter). Her children are in different grades. Premasila is the featured borrower of Maa Bhabani SHG- B. 

She has a livestock business and raises native chickens for sale. Her husband helps her in this business. 

Premasila, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Premasila will use her portion of loan amount to purchase materials to build steel chicken cages that have wider spaces for her chickens and to pay for more inventories of native chickens to sell. 

She deeply wishes to be able to sell more live chickens each week, so she can save enough money for future emergencies and to renovate her house. She hopes to become a supplier of chickens in towns and neighbourhoods.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build steel chicken cages that have wider spaces for her chickens and to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Urmila is a 34-year-old lady from the village Somabartota of Koraput district.The lady standing to the left in the photo is Urmila. 

She lives with her husband, who works as a labourer, and an ill mother-in-law. 

Urmila owns a grocery shop near her house where she sells items like wheat, flour, grams, pulses, soaps, detergents, talcum powder and other household items. The income earned by both Urmila and her husband is not sufficient to meet the daily household expenses, as a large part of the income is used in the treatment of her ill mother-in-law. 

Urmila, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. Urmila will use her portion to purchase other varieties of stock like chocolates, wafers and bakery items for her shop so that she can increase her earning capacity by meeting the market demand.

She aspires to build a concrete house for her family and save some money that she can use for constructive purposes.

loans.use: to purchase other varieties of stock like chocolates, wafers and bakery items for her shop.

loans.name: Suchana

texts.en:
Suchana, 48, hails from Falakata. She is from the village Harinathpur. She lives with her husband and four children. Two of her two children are students, one is a preschooler and one son works in a grill factory. Her husband is a farmer by profession. The family income is adequate to bear her children's educational expenses. 

Suchana's 19-year-old son, Tapash, reads at Khirerkote High School. He has been promoted to grade 12, scoring average marks. He chose the subjects of arts and he needs proper guidance for his grade 12 board examination. His ambition is to appear for the entrance exam to become a teacher; thus he is trying his level best to give his best in class 12 examinations. 

He needs to go to coaching classes and buy some books to do well in his board examination. But his parents are unable to fulfill his requirements with their limited means. 

To overcome this, Suchana has taken a loan from BJS ( Kiva's partner) to purchase all the necessary articles and pay the school fees and private tuition fees for her son. She will spend the entire loan amount for her son's education, so that he can smoothly go ahead with his studies and reach his goal.

Suchana and Tapash (in the picture) thank their lenders for the financial help.

loans.use: To cover all the education related costs of her son.

loans.name: Marco Fermin

texts.es:
Marco, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a hacer los oficios de su casa, aún no tienen hijos y en su casa vive su hermana y su cuñado pero solo su pareja depende económicamente de él.

Marco, tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz desde hace seis años, aprendió este trabajo gracias a un amigo que le enseño todo lo relacionado a la mecánica y luego decidió colocar su propio taller; no tiene otras actividades económicas, su taller está ubicado a 200 metros de distancia y viaja en bicicleta, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.


Marco, necesita el préstamo para construir una galera para poder pintar vehículos y que no se le mojen cuando llueva, con está galera podrá ofrecer más servicios a sus clientes y sus ganancias serán más. 

Sus sueños son, comprar un terreno para poder ampliar más su taller y tener más espacio para colocar más carros; además sueña con tener hijos con su pareja.
texts.en:
Marco is 28 years old. He went to school up to the ninth grade. He is married and his spouse takes care of the home. They don't have children yet and his sister and brother in law live in their house, but only his spouse depends on him financially.

Marco has had an auto mechanic shop for six years. He learned this work thanks to a friend who taught him everything related to mechanics. Later, he decided to open his own shop. He doesn't have any other financial activities. His shop is located 200 meters away and he gets there by bike. His work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.


Marco needs the loan to build a galley to paint vehicles where they won't get wet when it rains. With this galley, he will be able to offer more services to his customers and he will have more profit. 

His dream is to buy some land to be able to expand his shop more and have more space for more cars. He also dreams of having children with his wife.

loans.use: to build a a galley to paint vehicles where they won't get wet when it rains.

loans.name: Maa Bhabani Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Sabitri is a 39-year-old woman from the village Ramagiri of Koraput district and is the featured borrower of Maa Bhabani SHG- D.The lady standing to the right in the photo is Sabitri. 

She is a a very responsible and industrious woman. She lives with her husband, who works as a daily labourer, and seven children,  of whom five are married. The income of her husband does not suffice to meet the household expenses, so she took the concrete step to engage herself in certain income-generating activities so that she will be able to support her family to overcome the financial crisis. She started selling homemade pickles, jams and jellies to the nearby market to earn a living and provide basic necessities to her family.
 
Sabitri and her group member, Sebati, have requested a loan of 36,000 INR. Sabitri will use her portion of loan amount to purchase raw materials to strengthen her business such as mangoes, lemons, curry powder, turmeric powder, chilli powder, salt, vegetable oil and fruits. Getting the loan will help Sabitri in increasing the amount of output and she will be able to cater a larger customer base. This will help her in generating a higher amount of revenue, which she wants to reinvest in her business so as to expand and own a grocery shop for retail business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like mangoes, lemons, curry powder, turmeric powder, chilli powder, salt, vegetable oil and fruits.

loans.name: Maa Bhabani Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Dalimba, age 27 years, is the featured borrower of Maa Bhabani SHG- C of Ramagiri village of Koraput district. The lady standing to the left in the photo is Dalimba. 

She lives with her husband, who owns a grocery shop, and four children, who are in primary school in different grades. She has been involved in mushroom farming for the past two years, and she also supports her husband in the grocery business. Currently, the family earnings are barely enough to manage their family expenses and save for the future. So for future development, she has decided to cultivate mushrooms on a large scale, because it is a profitable crop.

Dalimba and her group member have requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Dalimba will use her portion of the loan to purchase inputs like fertilizers, manures and straw to facilitate the cultivation of mushrooms, so that she will be able to earn higher revenue that will bring her financial stability and security.

With the generated profit, she has a long-cherished desire to purchase another piece of farmland for more cultivation in the future and provide better educational facilities to her children.

loans.use: to purchase inputs like fertilizers, manures and straw to facilitate the cultivation of mushrooms.

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila ella es soltera y tiene 42 años y tiene 2  hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio negocio de venta de frutas , la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende platanos, naranjas y manzanas , la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos y uvas. 

Las socias que están pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” communal bank. It is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco.

One borrower is Lucila. She is single and 42 years old. She has 2 children. She works in her fruit selling business. She takes the fruit to different places and sells plantains, oranges and apples. She has had this business for several yeas and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the fruit. She is asking for the loan to buy oranges, plantains and grapes.

The borrowers who pictures are pasted to the group photo had their pictures taken after the meeting because they had to be absent because of work. 

The other borrowers have businesses such as selling fruit, selling chicha, a general store and selling animals.

She is grateful to those who are a part of this dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy oranges, plantains and grapes.

loans.name: Jesus Genoveva

texts.es:
Jesus tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a dar servicios de jornalería hace 25 años; además de ello a la crianza y comercialización de animales como pollos, gallos, gallinas, etc; su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio; Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales y para la compra de materiales para arreglos de su corral ya que se encuentra en mal estado, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad y variedad de animales, con gran influencia en el negocio, con esto Jesus espera tener mejor productividad para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona lo que incrementará sus ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
55-year old Jesus lives with her family in Oyotún District, a rural area where agriculture, commerce, and animal raising are the main activities. The area is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast. 

Jesus has been earning a living as day laborer for 25 years. She also raises and sells animals such as chickens, roosters, hens, and so on. Her farm is on her property.

She is requesting this loan to buy more animals and material to repair the chicken pen since it is in a poor condition. The investment will help Jesus to have a greater diversity and variety of animals and thus improve her business. She hopes to have a greater productivity and be able to meet the divers demand of her customers in this area, so she can increase her income and as a result improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and material to repair her chicken pen.

loans.name: Santa Rosa - Corao Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ROSA – CORAO.
La socia Rosalia tiene 51 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual el va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de animales entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Al momento de tomar la foto una de la socias con su sombrero tapo parte de la cara de otra socia, las socias son un poco tímidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the SANTA ROSA – CORAO.
Rosalia is 51 years old and is single.  She alternates between daily activities, raising small animals.
