She has had her business for some time and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She wants to be able to keep working to continue supporting her family in this way. 

She is asking for the loan to buy animals, among other things. 

The borrowers in general are thankful for the loan and committed to making their payments on time. At the time the photo was taken, one of the borrowers covered the face of another with her hat. The borrowers are a little shy.

loans.use: to buy animals, among other things.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira lives with her large family of six members in Raychenga village in Alipurduar district. She is 49 years old and a housewife. Her husband is engaged in a sack business, and he earns a meager income, quite insufficient for a family of six members. Mira's eldest son is a motor mechanic. One son is engaged in his father's business. Two others are in college.

Her 19-year-old son, Malay, is a student of Bachelor in Arts in Falakata College. Extra efforts are always worth it when it comes to studies because studies are the only sure way to improve one’s quality of life. Malay is well aware of this, because he has always had a goal of becoming a good teacher. Now he has reached the last step in completing his graduation. He is in B.A., third year now, and wants to pass with good results in his final exams. He needs the help of private tutors to score good marks, but his parents are unable to afford his educational expenses. 

So his mother, Mira, is asking for a loan from Kiva via BJS to pay for his college fees and private tutors’ fees, and also to purchase other necessary study materials for her son. She hopes in the long run her son to establish himself as a competent teacher. 

Mira and Malay are very much thankful to their generous lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay her son's educational expenses.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Sanjukta, a 42-year-old lady, is the featured borrower of Maa Durga SHG-B. The lady standing to the right in the photo is Sanjukta. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and two sons, who work as labourers. 

Sanjukta owns a tailoring shop in Somabartota village of Koraput district, where she does the work of repairing dresses for her customers.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Sanjukta will use her portion of loan to purchase a new sewing machine and other materials like threads, scissors, oil and needle for her sewing business. This will help her in getting more orders from customers and the execution of her work will be faster.

Sanjukta aspires to own a garment shop in the future so that she can increase her level of income and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and other materials like threads, scissors, oil and needle.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita hails from Falakata. She is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in Raychenga village in Falakata with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a farmer and she is a homemaker. Namita’s greatest motivation in life is to give her children proper education. 

Her elder son, Biplab, has just stepped into a Bachelor of Arts degree course and now he is in graduation first year at Falakata College. He is a brilliant student who scored good marks in his Higher Secondary Board exam. He works hard and wants to join a Bachelor of Education course after completion of his graduation. 

Until today, Biplab has had no tutor. Now he needs private coaching to score good marks, but his parents’ monthly income is not sufficient to bear the household cost as well as the educational expenses. 

Namita knows Biplab's potential and does not want to deprive him of any opportunity to excel. So she has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase her son’s educational materials, books and pay his college fees and tuition fees with the help of the loan amount, and ensure that Biplab can continue his education further. With the loan, Namita can go a step closer towards fulfilling Biplab’s dream of being a teacher in future. 

Biplab and his mother, Namita, (in the photo) are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay the cost of her son's graduation level education.

loans.name: Maa Bhabani Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Bashanti, age 33 years, is the featured borrower of Maa Bhabani SHG- E from the village Ramagiri of Koraput district. The lady standing to the left in the photo is Bashanti.

She lives with her five children and an ill husband, who is incapable of performing any work due to his health issue. So being the only earning person in her family, Sabitri really works very hard to sustain her livelihood. 

She owns two cows and is engaged in a milk-selling business. The income that she generates from selling milk is used in the treatment of her ill husband and the rest is used to meet the household expenses, though it is not sufficient.

Bashanti, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Bashanti will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase one more cow, so that she will be able to get more quantity of milk and will be able to generate a higher amount of income. In this way, she can have secured earnings and be able to meet all the requirements of the family and enjoy a happy living.

She aspires to add value in her milk business and wants to sell paneer, cheese, ghee and curd in the near future. She hopes to have a certain amount of savings that she will invest in the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow in order to generate higher revenue.

loans.name: Mairamkul

texts.ru: Майрамкул, 45 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. Майрамкул, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается сельским хозяйством, стартовав в 2005 году, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Майрамкул, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы, 15 овец, 2 лошади. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Также на 7,0 Га земли выращивает люцерну. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 14,000 сом (KGS). Майрамкул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки скота. Майрамкул намерена в дальнейшем расширять свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Mairamkul, 45, is married and has two children. She has been earning a living from agriculture since 2005. Through her resilience and hard work, Mairamkul now owns 15 sheep, 2 horses and 2 cows and sells milk on a daily basis. She grows alfalfa on a 7.0-ha plot of land. She has a monthly income of up to 14,000 som (KGS). 

Mairamkul is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy more livestock. She plans to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Chinara

texts.ru: Чинара успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чинара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого домашнего молока. Доходы от кредита Чинара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и постройку жилого дома.
texts.en:
Having used her previous loan as planned, Chinara has successfully paid it back. She is grateful to Kiva and all those who funded her previous loan. Chinara now owns 4 cows and 20 sheep, and her monthly income amounts to about 10,500 som (KGS). 

Chinara is requesting a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy a dairy cow and increase the volume of organic milk sales. She plans to reinvest the profit in her farm and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Cesar Hugo

texts.es:
Cesar Hugo tiene 44 años de edad, conviviente, vive con su conyugue y sus hijos en una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Cesar Hugo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como chivos, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de chivos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Cesar espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Hugo is 44 years old and lives with his spouse and their children in a rural zone of the La Matanza district, which is located in the Morropón province, Piura region, on the North coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work primarily in agriculture, cattle raising and trade.

Cesar Hugo works raising and selling small animals such as goats, ducks and turkeys, among others. His business is located at his home. He has years of experience in this business and very good personal and working references from the area. 

The loan he is applying for will be used to buy a large quantity of young goats among other animals, as well as balanced food for them. With this Cesar hopes to offer a better product to his customers, which will allow him to generate more income and in turn improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of young goats, as well as balanced food for them.

loans.name: Urkuyabubu

texts.ru: Уркуябубу, 29 лет, замужем, есть дочь, ей 6 лет. Образование у Уркуябубу среднее, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 2 года назад с 8,000 сом (KGS). Уркуябубу на участке мерою 0,45 ГА она выращивает рис. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 12,500 сом (KGS). Уркуябубу обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и оплату услуг трактора для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически-чистого риса. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и обучение дочери.
texts.en:
Urkuyabubu, 29, is married and has a 6-year-old daughter. She has a high school diploma and has been earning a living from livestock breeding and agriculture. She started out two years ago with a sum of 8,000 som (KGS). She grows rice on a 0.45-ha plot of land. She has a monthly income of approximately 12,500 som (KGS). 

Urkuyabubu is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy fertilizer and pay for using a tractor to cultivate land for growing organic rice. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business and educating her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for land cultivation in order to grow organic rice

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима, 54 года, замужем, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1995 году. Благодаря упорному труду Халимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 6,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Халима обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка и 5 овец с целью их откорма и дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Халима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Halima, 54, is married and has a son. She has a high school diploma and from 1995 has been making a living from livestock breeding. Through her hard work, she owns 2 cows and 10 sheep. Her monthly income amounts to about 6,800 som (KGS). 

Hoping to develop her farm, Halima is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy a calf and five sheep for fattening up and resale. She plans to invest the profit in more livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and five sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Syyakul

texts.ru: Сыякул, 48 лет, замужем. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 20 овец, лошадь. На сегодняшний день деятельность Сыякул приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 22,900 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку дойных коров для увеличения продаж экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Syyakul, 48, is married. She finished a vocational secondary school and is engaged in agriculture. She owns 4 cows, 20 sheep and a horse. Her farm makes a monthly profit of 22,900 som (KGS). 

Syyakul is requesting a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy dairy cows and to increase organic milk sales. She plans to reinvest the profit in her farm.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Kulbubu

texts.ru: Кулбубу, 44 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, 22 года она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 20 овец, также земельный надел мерою 2,09 ГА, где Кулбубу выращивает фасоль для реализации. Дети и супруг с радостью помогают Кулбубу в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Ежемесячный доход Кулбубу около 25,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для реализации экологически-чистого домашнего молока. Доходы от кредита Кулбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит ей накопить на приобретение дома.
texts.en:
Kulbubu, 44, is married and has 5 children. She has a high school diploma and for 22 years has been engaged in agriculture. She owns 5 cows, 20 sheep and a 2.09-ha plot of land where she grows haricot beans for sale. Her husband and children happily help her around the farm, and she has created all the necessary conditions for breeding livestock. Her monthly income is about 25,000 som (KGS). 

Kulbubu is requesting a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy 2 cows and sell organic milk. She plans to invest the profit in more livestock and to save up for a house.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to sell organic milk

loans.name: Abida

texts.ru: Абида, 55 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 23 года в качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Абиды на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 15 овец. На 0,72 Га собственного и 0,50 Га арендованного земельного надела она выращивает ячмень. Также занимается торговле товарами повседневного назначения. Абида обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку материалов для строительства сарая для скота, часть средства направит на приобретение товара для торговли. Доходы от кредита Абида планирует вложить в дальнейшее ее бизнеса и образование детей.
texts.en:
Abida, 55, is married and has 3 children. She has a high school diploma and in the past 23 years has earned a living by breeding livestock and cultivating land. Through her hard work, Abida now owns 2 cows and 15 sheep. She grows barley on 0.72 ha of her own and 0.50 ha of rented land. She also sells goods of daily use. 

Abida is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy construction materials for a livestock barn. She will use part of the loan to buy goods for sale. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and in her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a liverstock barn and to buy goods for retail sale in her shop

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more 5 bags of raw rice for her business

loans.name: Teegawende  Moince Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALIMATA est responsable du TEEGAWENDE MOINCE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme fait le jardinage et aussi du commerce depuis 2005. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Elle veut s’acheter 03boites de graines de semences (courgette, concombre, oignon) et 04sacs d’engrais pour son jardinage.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour prendre soin de sa famille et renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne pouvoir s'acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Salimata is the leader of the Teegawende Moince Group. She is in good health. She is a married mother to five children; her eldest is 19 years old and her youngest is four years old. One of her children is attending school and she has six people living in her care.

Salimata has been growing vegetables and running her own business since 2005. She gets her supplies from the local markets. She wants to purchase three boxes of seeds (courgette, cucumber, onion) and four sacks of fertilizer for her gardening activities.

Salimata wants to use the profits to look after her family and strengthen her business. Her dream is to be able to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase three boxes of seeds (courgette, cucumber, onion) and four sacks of fertilizer for their gardening activities

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is aged 28 years and she supports 2 children. She has been a shop keeper for the last 1 year and the business earns her KES 4,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase additional stock of retail goods like cooking oil and baking flour for sale to clients. 

She plans to use gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and also purchase chicks for poultry keeping as well as fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm. 

Her hope is to expand her business sector and also her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of retail goods like cooking oil and baking flour for sale to clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: N10Khu3Qlào-Sustainable Development Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dung is 34 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 5 years. Dung lives in Yen Dinh district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Dung faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

In 2015, Dung joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 56 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

Nelly has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like softdrinks, rice, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik and her nice family live in Mrgashat village of Armavir region. Hasmik's family owns a piece of land where they grow cabbage and tomato, which they sell in local markets. Besides agriculture, Hasmik also works in the village school's library. 

Hasmik now asks this loan to purchase fertilizer, 3 oxen and give salaries to workers who helped with land cultivation works. She hopes very much that Kiva will support her and help to better her family's poor living conditions.

 This is Hasmik's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions previously, was very difficult to return back, and Hasmik faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her family were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, Hasmik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Please support Hasmik with her loan and help her to sustain the farm.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, 3 oxen and give salaries to workers who helped with land cultivation work

loans.name: Erkebubu

texts.ru: Эркебубу, 57 лет, замужем. У нее средне-специальное образование, она уже много лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Эркебубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 40 овец, 2 лошади. На 2,0 Га земли она выращивает клевер и перец для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности Эркебубу составляет около 19,900 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, часть средств потратит на обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита позволят Эркебубу развить ее бизнес, улучшить благосостояние семьи и приобрести необходимую в хозяйстве стиральную машину.
texts.en:
Erkebubu, 57, is married. She finished a vocational secondary school and has been making a living from agriculture. Through her hard work, she owns 2 cows, 40 sheep and 2 horses. She grows clover and peppers for sale on a 2.0-ha plot of land. Her monthly profit amounts to about 19,900 som (KGS).

Erkebubu is requesting a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy more livestock and to cultivate land. She plans to invest the profit in her business, improve her family’s well-being and purchase a washing machine.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd and to cultivate her land

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 46 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее - средне-специальное образование, работает поваром в больнице. Также в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Собственный бизнес начала в 1989 году и развила его. В хозяйстве Айнуры есть 2 коровы, 6 овец, лошадь. в аренде 0,50 Га земли, где она выращивает ячмень.  Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма на пастбище и реализации. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, также она мечтает дать своим младшим детям высшее образование.
texts.en:
Ainura, 46, is married and has 3 children. She finished a vocational secondary school. Her family’s primary sources of income are livestock breeding and agriculture. She started her business in 1989 and now has 2 cows, 6 sheep and a horse. She also rents a 0.50-ha plot of land where she grows barley. 

Ainura is requesting a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy steer calves for fattening up in the pasture and resale. She plans to reinvest the profit in her farm so as to fulfill her dream of sending her children to university.

loans.use: to purchase some steer calves for fattening in the pasture and resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 26 years old rural smallholder farmer from Bomet area of Kenya. He lives with his wife and 3 children on a 3 acre piece of land where he practices dairy dairy farming for a living. 

David is seeking a loan to start commercial poultry farming. He has no poultry at the moment but plans to buy 20 heads of poultry with the loan amount. He is going for the traditional breeds that are well-adapted to local conditions. Through this venture, David's plan is to seize opportunity of growing demand for poultry products in the market. 
David will use any income from poultry farming to improve his family’s well-being and pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy poultry to expand his farming activity

loans.name: Teltaaba /moince Group

texts.fr:
Mme HABIBOU est responsable du TELTAABA/MOINCE. Elle se porte bien ainsi que les autres membres. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme fait le maraichage depuis 2007. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01boite de semence d’oignon.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour aider son mari à nourrir la famille et renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne pouvoir s'acheter des animaux pour faire de l'élevage.
texts.en:
Habibou is the leader of the Teltaaba/Moince Group. She is in good health, as are the other members, She is a married mother to four children; her eldest is 21 years old and her youngest is six years old. One of her children is attending school and she has five people living in her care.

Habibou has been growing vegetables since 2007. She gets her supplies from the local markets. She wants to purchase one box of onion seeds.

Habibou wants to use the profits to assist her husband in feeding their family and to strengthen her business. Her dream is to be able to purchase livestock so she can get into livestock farming.

loans.use: to purchase one box of onion seeds

loans.name: Dun's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Tbaung Khum district of Kampong Cham province, Dun is 60 years old and a married mother of seven children, one of whom is dependent on her. To make a living, she grows cassava as the main source of income, and she has been in this business for 42 years already. She cannot sell her crop products at a good price; therefore, she can earn only about 27,400 KHR per day.

This time, she leads a group of nine members to take out a new loan. Dun has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles already, and this will be her third time. The previous loan has enabled her to improve her living condition and to buy household supplies for daily use.

As the leader, she will use her loan to buy cassava seeds, organic pesticides, and organic fertilizers for her cash crop. She hopes to earn more income to update her standard of living much better than before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds, organic pesticides, and organic fertilizers for her cash crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the areas for more income gain

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is a 39-year-old married woman and has two sons, aged 17 and 10 years old. She runs a sari-sari store business. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns about PHP10000 per month. 

Yvonne is asking a loan to buy spices, chips, candies, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, laundry soap, bath soap, powdered juice, and powdered milk. Her greatest dream is to have a better future with her family and for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy spices, chips, candies, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, laundry soap, bath soap, powdered juice, and powdered milk

loans.name: Barchagul

texts.ru: Барчагул, 35 лет, в разводе, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает в Войсковой части резчиком хлеба. Ежемесячная заработная плата составляет 12,185 сом (KGS). Барчагул с детьми живут на последнем этаже многоквартирного дома и с наступлением дождей, крыша протекает, в доме холодно и сыро. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку материалов для перекрытия и утепления крыши. Свои доходы Барчагул будет откладывать, так как она хочет накопить на покупку собственного дома.
texts.en:
Barchagul, 35, is divorced. She is a mother of three children. She finished a vocational secondary school and makes a living as a breadcutter at a military unit. Her monthly salary is 12,185 som (KGS). Barchagul and her children live at the highest floor of an apartment building. When it rains, the roof starts leaking and the apartment gets cold and damp. 

Barchagul is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy insulation materials for fixing her roof. She plans to save up for a house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for insulation and fixing the roof in her apartment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a precision seed-drill

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул, 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 сыновей. У Айгул- средне-специальное образование, она шьет на заказ женскую одежду, национальные изделия, чехлы для автомобилей. На протяжении 15 лет в качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Айгул на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы. На 0,40 Га собственного и 2,0 Га арендованного земельного надела выращивает фасоль и клевер. Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на сбор урожая органического клевера и фасоли. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Aigul, 38, is married and has 2 sons. Aigul finished a vocational secondary school and earns a living as a tailor. She makes clothes, Kyrgyz artisanal products and cases for cars. For 15 years she has been engaged in livestock breeding and land cultivation. Through her hard work, she now owns 2 cows. She grows haricot beans and clover on 0.40 ha of her own and 2.0 ha of rented land. 

Aigul is requesting a loan of 45,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to harvest organic clover and haricot beans. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business and renovating her house.

loans.use: to harvest organic clover and haricot

loans.name: Gary

texts.en:
His name is Gary, 37 and he comes from the island of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. He is happily married to Doralyn, an Accounting Officer. Gary thought of putting up a small general store to augment their income so they can fully provide for their four elementary school children and for their daily sustenance. 

Gary operates a general store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. He earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. He is glad that he can look after their kids since  his store is just by his house. Jun has a charming personality that people prefer to buy at his store. 

He hopes that he can request for a Php 50000 loan to expand his store. He will use the proceeds of his loan to buy large quantities of grocery items such as sacks of rice, canned goods,instant noodles, tasty, biscuits, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages. He wants to make sure that he offers all essential food items to better serve the everyday kitchen needs of his community. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help. His store means so much to his family as it helps provide for their daily needs and for the schooling of his children.

Gary's dream is to grow his business to give his family a better quality of life. He wants to give his children the best education to allow them better opportunities. He faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To add more grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at his store.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул, 55 лет, вдова, есть 2 сына и дочь. У нее средне-специальное бухгалтерское образование, много лет проработала по специальности. Сейчас занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая свою семью. Благодаря упорному труду Нургул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 2 лошади. На 3,70 Га земли выращивает картофель, ячмень, люцерну для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. Поэтому Нургул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока. Доходы от кредита позволят Нургул развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Nurgul, 55, is a widow and has 2 sons and a daughter. She finished a vocational accounting school and spent many years working as an accountant. She earns her living from agriculture. Through her hard work, she owns 4 cows and 2 horses. She grows potatoes, barley and alfalfa for sale on a 3.70 ha plot of land. Her monthly income is about 5,000 som (KGS) but this amount is not enough to provide a decent life for her family. 

Nurgul is requesting a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy a dairy cow and to increase organic milk sales. She plans to invest the profit in her business and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Azadahan

texts.ru: Азадахан, 49 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей, все активно помогают по хозяйству. У Азадахан среднее образование, сельским хозяйством занимается с 2009 года. На сегодня в хозяйстве есть 4 овцы. Также на 2,25 Га собственной земли Азадахан с семьей выращивают рис для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 21,000 сом (KGS). Азадахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и оплату услуг трактора для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита Азадахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и образование детей в университете.
texts.en:
Azadahan, 49, is married and has 3 children who actively help her with household chores. She has a high school diploma and from 2009 has been engaged in agriculture. She has four sheep. She and her family grow rice for sale on her 2.25-ha plot of land. Her average monthly income is 21,000 som (KGS). 

Azadahan is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy fertilizer and pay for a tractor to cultivate land. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and in her children’s university education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for land cultivation for growing organic rice

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 49 лет, замужем, есть сын. У нее высшее образование, работает на почте. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Гульмира занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2000 году, благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 14 овец, а на земельной доле мерою 2,0 Га арендованной и 0,24 Га собственной земли выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически-чистой фасоли. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulmira, 49, is married and has a son. She has a university degree and works at a post office. Since 2000 she has been engaged in livestock breeding and land cultivation. Through her hard work, she owns 2 cows and 14 sheep. She grows haricot beans for sale on 2.0 ha of rented and 0.24 ha of her own land. Hoping to develop her farm, Gulmira is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy fertilizer for cultivating land and growing organic haricot beans. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for land cultivation and growing organic haricot

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es:
Sandra, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, esta acompañada, su pareja es panificador y tiene una hija que aún no estudia porque está muy pequeña.

Sandra, tiene venta de tortillas desde hace tres años, aprendió a hacer tortillas gracia a su mamá cuando era pequeña; la venta de tortillas la tiene frente a su casa y su horario de venta es desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta la 1:00 p.m.

Ella necesita el préstamos para comprar más maíz y leña para hacer las tortillas, con este préstamo ella podrá aumentar la producción de tortillas y sus ganancias mejoraran.

Sus sueños son, arreglar su casa y que su hija pueda estudiar, para que se prepare dedicadamente.
texts.en:
Sandra is 23 years old and completed high school. She is married and her husband is a baker. They have a daughter who is too young to attend school.

Sandra has sold tortillas for the past three years. She learned to make tortillas from her mother when she was young. She sells the tortillas in front of her house from 8:00 am until 1:00 pm. 

She needs this loan in order to purchase more corn and firewood to make tortillas. With this loan, she will be able to increase her production of tortillas and her income will increase. Her dreams are to repair her home and for her daughter to attend school so that she can diligently prepare for her life.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Dinar

texts.ru: Динар, 38 лет, замужем, есть дочь. Динар более 18 лет занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день Динар имеет 8 коров, 2 овцы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для продажи экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Dinar, 38, is married and has a daughter. For over 18 years she has been earning a living from livestock breeding. She now owns 8 cows and 2 sheep. 

Dinar is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy a dairy cow and increase organic milk sales. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 35 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей, образование высшее. Уже много лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Элмира достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме до 17,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Тазагул имеется 2 коровы, 30 овец. По хозяйству помогают супруг и дети. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, удобрений для полеводства. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Elmira, 35, is married and has 6 children. She is a university graduate. She earns a living from livestock breeding. Through her hard work and efficiency, Elmira built up a successful farm, which makes a monthly profit of 17,000 som (KGS). She now owns 2 cows and 30 sheep. Her husband and children help her around the farm. 

Elmira is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy additional livestock and fertilizer. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business and renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy some livestock as well as fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Феруза, 24 года, не замужем, детей нет, живет с родителями. По характеру Феруза очень трудолюбивая и ответственная . В качестве источника дохода для семьи, она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Имеет развитое хозяйство, а именно 3 коровы, 2овцы, лошадь, а также на земельном наделе мерою 1,0 ГА, где она выращивает рис. Феруза получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 18,000 сом (KGS). Она хочет развить свой бизнес, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для выращивания экологически-чистого риса. Доходы от кредита Феруза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и улучшение условий проживания семьи.
texts.en:
Feruza, 24, is single and has no children. She lives with her parents and makes a living from land cultivation and livestock breeding. She is hardworking and responsible and has a successful farm with 3 cows, 2 sheep and a horse. She also grows rice on a 1.0-ha plot of land. Today her farm makes a monthly profit of 18,000 som (KGS). 

Feruza is requesting a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to buy fertilizer for growing organic rice. She plans to reinvest the profits in her farm and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for land cultivation and growing organic rice

loans.name: G.s. Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
El G.S Las Rosas está conformado por tres integrantes madres solteras, con siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarias de  Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron  estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Nereyda y tiene por actividad económica el servicio de costura ubicado en su casa de habitación, el negocio consiste en elaborar prendas de vestir como: pantalones, shores, faldas, blusa, vestidos, ropa de cama, juegos de baños etc. Ella dedica  a su negocio unos ochos horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la subsistencia de sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de sus prendas como. Telas, hilos, agujas, aceite de máquina, carrete, forros, cintas de mantequillas, botones, broches ziper etc. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. G.S. Las Rosas agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Las Rosas group is made up of three members who are single mothers. In total, they have seven children in their care. They are from Nagarote, which is located in the northern zone of the region. They are hardworking, responsible, and would like to improve themselves. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were unable to study and had to begin working at a young age in order to help with household expenses. Today, they fight day to day in order to bring their children forward.

Due to her desire to move forward, Nereyda is the coordinator of the group. She has a clothing store in her home and sells items like, pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, dresses, pajamas, bathing suits, etc. She tends to her store for 8 hours every day and enjoys her business a lot because it has allowed her to make a living and support her children.

She will use the loan to invest in raw materials like fabric, thread, needles, machine oil, bobbins, linings, ribbon, buttons, brooches, zippers, etc. so that she can earn more money in the near future.

The Las Rosas group thanks Kiva lenders for the help and for providing dignified jobs to people with few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like thread, fabric, ribbon, buttons, brooches, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Virun

texts.en:
Virun is 20 years old, single and lives in the Siem Reap province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting and finance. Virun also works for a hotel as a cashier, earning USD $3 each day. 

Due to the fact that she is short of the funds to pay her second-semester tuition fees of the second year, she would like to take out a loan. This loan will help her to go through the second year successfully. 

After graduation, she wants to work in a bank or a micro finance institution with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to save up for running a business.

loans.use: to pay her second-semester tuition fees of the second year

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Dios es Amor está conformada por ocho mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres responsables, con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta  disfrutar de la compañía de su  familia. Día a día luchan para sacar adelante a sus negocios, todos tiene diferentes actividades económicas las cuales disfrutan mucho ya que ha sido la forma de sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Corina y tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como; arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leña, pan, huevos, mantequilla, cuajadas, jabón, jugos, hielo, fósforos, cigarrillos etc. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación  y dedica unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos,  para satisfacer la clientela, obtener más clientes, y mejorar sus ingresos en un futuro no tan lejano. Dios es Amor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community association Dios es Amor is composed of eight women and one man. They are responsible parents with fifteen children under their responsibility. They are from Malpaisillo, a place located in the northern part of the region characterized by responsible working people wanting self-improvement. In their free time, they like to enjoy the company of their family. They struggle daily to run their businesses. Everyone has a different economic activity, which has been how they support their families for a long time. 

Thanks to her desire to succeed, Corina runs a grocery store. It is a small store that sells food products in small quantities: rice, beans, sugar, firewood, bread, eggs, butter, cheese curds, soap, juice, matches, cigarettes, etc. The business is located in her house and she spends about 12 hours a day selling her products to customers. She wants to get more customers and increase her income in the not too distant future. 

Dios es Amor is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders offer to poor people in poor countries such as Nicaraguas which allows them to have dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her grocery store with rice, beans, and more

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru: Гульнар, 45 лет, замужем, 1 ребенок. У Гульнар высшее образование, она работает старшей медицинской сестрой, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес 25 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Гульнар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 5 овец. Бизнес Гульнар в месяц приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульнар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и покупку мебели.
texts.en:
Gulnar, 45, is married and has a child. She has a university degree and works as a senior nurse. In addition, she makes a living from livestock breeding and land cultivation. She started this business 25 years ago. Through her hard work, Gulnar owns 2 cows and 5 sheep. Her farm makes a monthly profit of about 20,000 som (KGS). 

Gulnar is requesting a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to develop her farm. The loan would help her to increase her livestock headcount. She plans to invest the profit in more livestock and to buy furniture.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Zuura

texts.ru: Зуура, 44 года, замужем, имеет 5 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование. По словам матери, дети и муж активно помогают по хозяйству. Зуура в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 40 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Зууры, ее деятельность позволяет приносить около 16,000 KGS сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зуура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для выезда и выпаса скота на пастбище. Доходы от кредита Зуура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы в перспективе построить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Zuura, 44, is married and has 5 children. She finished a vocational secondary school. According to her, her husband and children actively help her with around the farm. Zuura earns a living from livestock breeding. Today she owns 4 cows and 40 sheep. Thanks to her hard work, she makes about 16,000 som (KGS) a month, which covers her family’s basic living expenses. Hoping to expand her business, 

Zuura is requesting a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy a horse so as to be able to graze her livestock in the pasture. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business and eventually build a big house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a horse for grazing her livestock in the field

loans.name: Tillahan

texts.ru: Тиллахан, 59 лет, вдова, 2 детей. На протяжении 10 лет Тиллахан занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Тиллахан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход Тиллахан составляет  около 18,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тиллахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Tillahan, 59, is a widow and has two children. In the past ten years, she has been earning a living from livestock breeding. Through her hard work, she owns 5 cows and 20 sheep. Her monthly income is about 18,000 som (KGS) but this amount is not enough to provide a decent life for her family. 

Hoping to expand her business, Tillahan is requesting a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy additional livestock for breeding. She plans to reinvest the profit in livestock.

loans.use: to buy some livestock and increase her income

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: A sus 26 años Karla ha logrado salir adelante en sus estudios gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos, esta mujer emprendedora estudia administración de empresas y desde ya está poniendo en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos porque se dedica a vender churros en colegios y escuelas de su ciudad. Escogió esta carrera porque le ofrece diferentes áreas en donde desempeñarse como profesional. Para obtener su sueño y convertirse en una verdadera profesional Karla solicita un crédito para pagar su título que la acredita como licenciada en Administración de Empresas. Dentro de sus metas próximas esta formar su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Karla, a 26-year-old woman, has managed to move forward in her studies thanks to the support of her husband and their children. She is an entrepreneurial woman who is studying business administration. She has put the knowledge she has gained into practice by selling churros at high schools and other schools in the city. She chose this career because it offers different areas in which to be a professional.

In order to achieve her dream and become a true professional, Karla requests a loan to pay for her degree, which will accredit her as a Business Administration graduate. Among her goals is forming her own business.

loans.use: to pay for her degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, beams, and nails to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is aged 25 years, married to Everline and he supports 2 children.  He has been selling electrical goods for the last 3 years and the business earns him KES 15,000 per month.
 
He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more stocks of electrical goods and products such as radios, televisions and cables for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.  

He plans to use gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and also repay the loan. 
His hope is to expand his business sector and also purchase chicks for keeping and later sell them to his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of electrical goods and products such as radios, televisions and cables for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: 03Minhthắng-Hard Working For A Better Life Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà is 30 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling general things such as cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc., for more than 10 years.

Hà lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Hà faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell.

In 2009, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is a reputable person in the community. 

Hà and four other women established the loan group "03MinhThắng-Hard Working For A Better Life" to get a loan and share the experience of doing business for a better life.

Along with her business profit, Hà hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en:
Volodya is a farmer of 53 years old. He lives with his wife in Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkunik region. Their two sons are in the Russian Federation doing work abroad, and they greatly support their parents from there, sending money for their living expenses. Their daughter is married, and she lives with her family. 

While in the village, Volodya is engaged in farming, and he does his work with great pleasure. In his farm he has cows, bulls, sheep and a lot of chickens (110 chickens). So Volodya is seriously engaged in poultry in his farm, and he sells his farm’s milk, meat (beef, mutton and poultry) and also eggs. 

Volodya wants to enlarge the assortment of dairy products from his farm, but for this he needs more milk. So he will be thankful if Kiva lenders help him with a loan and also with the purchase of one more cow for his farm and fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for his farm and fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a biogas system for clean energy for cooking

loans.name: N1Qhưng-Let Children Go To School Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tương  is 62 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fruit for more than 10 years.
Tương  lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable . 
The main hardship that Tương  faces is lack of capital.  

In 2013, Tương  joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Tương  has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. 

She is a reputable person in the community. Tương and 4 other women establish the loan group "N1QHưng-Let children go to school" to get loan and share experience to do business for a better life.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.
With her business profit, Tương  hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. Nena is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nena requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soap, shampoo, noodles, egg, spices, milk, etc. to sell.
Nena has been in this business for 10 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.
In the future, Nena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, spices, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 39 years old, married with four children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a pre-paid mobile load in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more pre-paid load to re-sell.

Merilyn has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the pre-paid mobile load for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell frozen food.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more pre-paid mobile phone load to re-sell

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab, 39 years old married woman lives in Batumi with her daughter and husband Jimsher. Zeinab and her husband are unemployed. The family lives in poverty. They decided to purchase a car and Jimsher will start taxi business. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for purchasing a car. As the car is purchased, Jimsher will drive it to serve locals as a driver. He will generate stable income and they will be able to cover everyday expenses. Zeinab awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and his husband will serve locals as a taxi driver to generate income

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is 33 years old and he lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. He is married and he lives with his wife and son. Arsen now works at a private workshop as a manager.

 Arsen loves and cares for his family very much, but now his wife has some health problems and Arsen needs financial support. This loan of 700.000 Armenian Drams Arsen asks in order to solve his lovely wife’s health problems.

loans.use: to solve his lovely wife’s health problems

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha, 41, lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of five children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in his types of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $3 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: N13Bắcthọ-Hate Delinquent Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hân is 47 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling general things such as cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc., for more than 10 years.

Hân lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, this region often suffers natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 

The main hardship that Hân faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc., to resell.

In 2009, Hân joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Hân has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Along with her business profit, Hân hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc., to resell

loans.name: Rezil

texts.en:
Rezil is 31 years old and a widow. With three children who are in school, Rezil works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buying and selling of nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Rezil has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
This woman’s name is Lia, and she lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Lia is married and she lives with her husband (he is a worker), two daughters and her mother-in-law. 

Lia has a specialty in accounting, and for several years, she managed to work in her specialty.  Usually Lia is a very active and cheerful woman, and as she says, she never feels tired. But lately she feels unhealthy, which has greatly changed her usual way of living. 

This Kiva loan she asks for in order to solve her health problems, for which she is thankful beforehand.

loans.use: to solve her health problems, for which she is thankful beforehand

loans.name: N17Thànlập-Fish Filled The Net Group

texts.en:
Thùy is 28 years old and married.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for five years.
Thùy lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village. This region has often suffered from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
The main hardship that Thùy faces is lack of capital. 
In 2009, Thùy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thùy has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community. Thùy and four other women established the loan group N17ThànLập-Fish Filled the Net to get loans and share their experiences in business for better lives.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to catch seafood to sell.
With her business profit, Thùy hopes to buy land of her own, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch seafood to sell.

loans.name: Arpik

texts.en: Arpik lives with her big family in Sevan city, in the Gegharknik region. She is married and has two daughters and a son. Arpik used to work at a hotel as a cleaner and now she works at a private workshop as a cook. Arpik is worried about her beloved husband’s health and this Kiva loan she requests will help  solve her husband’s health problems as soon as possible.

loans.use: to solve her husband’s health problems as soon as possible

loans.name: Rhea Jean

texts.en:
Rhea Jean is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending.

Rhea Jean dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Push Off Group

texts.en:
Tươi is 32 years old and married.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for eight years.
Tươi lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village. This region has often suffered from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
The main hardship that Tươi faces is lack of capital.  
In 2009, Tươi joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Tươi has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community. Tươi and four other women established the loan group Push Off to get loans and share their experiences in business for better lives
She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to catch seafood to sell.
With her business profit, Tươi hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch seafood to sell.

loans.name: N6K6Lsơn-I Dream A Dream Group

texts.en:
Mrs Loan is 33 years old and is married  She has had a service business shipping goods for 5 years.
Loan lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable . 
The main hardship that Loan faces is lack of capital.  She is a reputable person in the community.

Although this is Loan's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every members agreed to vote her to be the leader of "N6K6LSơn-I dream a dream" group. She is requesting a loan to maintain the truck to do transportation service.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to maintain the truck used for transportation services

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 41 years old, married to Robert and supports a family of 5 children. She has been selling banana in  the market for the last 13  years earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Hellen has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production to supply in the society for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production to supply in the society for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.name: Margush

texts.en: Margush lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. She has two daughters who are both married and live with their families. Margush has two higher pedagogical education degrees. She has many years of pedagogical experience and works at the school as a teacher of mathematics in elementary classes. She likes her work and manages it with great responsibility and care. She helps any pupil who may have questions or is unclear about a lesson. This loan Margush is seeking will enable her to purchase a computer with accessories and also some methodological literature in her specialty.

loans.use: to buy a computer with accessories and also some methodological literature in her specialty

loans.name: N20Bắcthọ- Not Mind Difficult Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vinh is 46 years old and married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for more than 10 years. Vinh lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. This region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 

The main hardship that Vinh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell. In 2014, Vinh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Vinh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Vinh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Her name is Dolores, 48, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Rizal, her business partner, and mother to six children of which three are already working and the other three young kids just stay home. Majority of the Filipinos struggle to make a living in a poor country like Phils. but Dolores and her husband are resourceful and responsible enough to source means to provide their family's needs. 

Dolores operates a buy and sell business. She buys RTW clothes and other household needs from wholesalers and sells them at retail price. Although there are a number of people who has the same kind of business as hers she perseveres and trusts God that she earns enough for their basic needs. Typical of mothers who love their family, Dolores is always hopeful that life will get better for them.

She is now humbly asking your help for a 30000 loan to infuse capital for her buy and sell business. She will use the proceeds of the loan to buy tarpaulin, rain coat, shorts, blankets, pillow cases. Now that is rainy season in the Phils, tarpaulins, rain coats are already in demand. She will be grateful and is thanking God and you in advance for the help that will be extended to her. Her buy and sell business is their only means of livelihood.

Dolores hopes to be able to grow her business. She prays that God will crown her efforts with success. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for tarpaulin, rain coat, shorts, blankets, pillow cases, etc.to sell.

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en:
Evanson is a man with willingness to work. He wakes up very early in the morning when the birds are still asleep to go and tend to his small parcel of land. Evanson is a 40-year-old farmer from Mitunguu village, situated in Nkubu area of Kenya. He lives together with his wife and three children, on a small piece of land where he keeps cows,pigs and grows a wide variety of crops. For ten years, his primary sources of income have been pig farming, milk and horticultural produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals to prevent these diseases.

Evanson made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo, in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. Sometime last month, he applied for a loan to buy seeds and expanding his horticulture farm. This will enable him to expand his operations, to increase the overall output.

The additional income from the expansion will go to his children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out and start working, to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Evanson’s children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: To expand into horticulture farming to increase his farming activities and keep his children in school

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. Analyn is married and has a hardware and construction materials business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of hardware materials to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Analyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of hardware and construction materials to sell

loans.name: Angela De Jesus

texts.es:
Angela, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está soltera y tiene dos hijos, los dos tiene sus propios hogares, uno vive en Estados Unidos y el otro cerca de la casa de Angela, con ella vive un nieto.

Angela, vende ropa desde hace 5 años, inicio vendiendo en el mercado de la ciudad de manera ambulante; ahora sale a vender a 1 kilómetro de distancia desde su casa y viaja en bus y su horario es desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 p.m.

Angela, necesita el préstamo para comprar unos paquetes de ropa, porque se los están vendiendo a buen precio, con la adquisición de estos paquetes ella obtendrá mayores ganancias porque el precio en que los compro es más barato que como regularmente los compra. 

Ella, sueña con poner un puesto de venta en el centro de la ciudad, porque hay más afluencia de personas; además espera que sus hijos la apoyen cuando sea necesario.
texts.en:
Angela, 54, has a 5th grade education.  She is single and has 2 children who each have their own homes.  One of them lives in the United States, and the other lives close to Angela's house.  Angela lives with a grandchild.

Angela has been selling clothing for 5 years.  She started out selling from place to place in a local market. Now she goes out to sell one kilometer away from her house.  She travels by bus, and she works from 6am until 12pm.

Angela needs a loan to buy some bales of clothing, because they are being sold now for a good price.  With these bales she will generate more earnings, because the price that she will pay for the clothes is much less than what she usually pays.

Angela dreams of having a sales stall in the center of the city, because there is a greater influx of people there.  In addition, she hopes that her children will support her when she needs it.

loans.use: to buy some bales of clothing

loans.name: Amir’S Group

texts.en:
Amir is resident of Lung, a remote village in district Gujranwala in, Pakistan. He is the sole bread earner of his family and cultivates rice and wheat crops in a seasonal manner. 

He and his group members are poor farmers and have always struggled to finance their agricultural inputs in timely manner. With the anticipated credit facility the group members are hopeful to finance their inputs for their rice crop in a timely manner and ensure better yield. 

Group members are committed to be responsible borrowers.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.for their rice crop

loans.name: Extremely Fresh Sea Food- N25 Bắcthọ Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhung is 42 years old and she is married.  She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.
Nhung lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. .
The main hardship that Nhung faces is lack of capital.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sea food to resell. She is a reputable person in the community.

Although this is Nhung  first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every members agreed to vote her to be the leader of "Extremely fresh sea food- N25 BắcThọ" group.
With her business profit, Nhung hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more sea food to resell

loans.name: Hezekiah

texts.en:
Hezekiah is 41 years old, married and supports a family of six children. He has been operating in motorcycle transport for the last 16 years earning KES15,000 per month. 


Hezekiah has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the areas for more income gain. 


He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the areas for more income gain.

loans.name: Sheila May Hope

texts.en:
Sheila May Hope is 29 years old, married, and has three children, who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Sheila May Hope requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sheila May Hope has been farming sugarcane for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Muhammad’S Group

texts.en:
Muhammad and his group members earn their livelihood through farming, growing rice and wheat. They live in a village named Lung located in Punjab in Pakistan. 

The group members are cash strapped and rely on middlemen for the provision of seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel. The middlemen take advantage of their position and take a chunk of their earnings as a cost of providing inputs. 

The group members want to get rid of middlemen and requested a loan to finance their input requirements for their rice crop. This loan will help them to eliminate the middlemen and increase their revenue.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase: wood, nails and aluminum sheets to replace the roof of his galley which has been considerably deteriorated with time.

loans.name: Orange Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her mid 40s, is married with five school-going children. For the past four years, she has been selling different types of drinks in her grocery. She works from 2 pm to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Mariam's  tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy drinks like beer,soda water and wines. She dreams of expand her business. She will share this loan with her loan group "Orange," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks like beer, soda water and wines.

loans.name: Samuel Francisco

texts.es:
Samuel de 50 años de edad, casado con tres hijos menores de edad, lo cuales están estudiando, es originario del Sauce, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de productos lácteos. Samuel se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable con ganas de superación persona.
