Lamentablemente solamente pudo estudiar hasta la secundaria por falta de recursos económicos, en la actualidad lucha día a día para vencer los desafíos que se van presentado como hacer crecer su negocio, obtener nuevos clientes, y sacar a sus hijos  adelante y brindarles mejores oportunidades de vida.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelanta tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, el negocio lo desempeña desde hace doce años, la rutina de trabajo de este hombre es de una doce horas diarias para poder brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el negocio consiste en vender productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jabón, jugos, galletas, gaseosa, tiste, fósforos, verduras, hielos, salsa de tomates etc. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Samuel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Samuel is 50 years old and is married with three minor children who are all in school.  He is from Sauce, a place that is known for being a producer of milk products.  Samuel is known for being a hard worker, responsible, and with a desire for personal betterment.  Sadly he was only able to study through middle school due to limited economic means.  Currently he struggles each day to overcome challenges that he faces such as learning how to grow his business, obtain new clients, and help his children get ahead.  He wants to offer them the best opportunities in life. 

Thanks to his desire to get ahead he started a grocery store located in his home.  The business has been in operation for 12 years.  His daily routine includes working 12 hour days in order to bring better service to his customers.  The business involves selling consumable products in small quantities and the loan will be used to buy things like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, soap, juices, cookies, matches, vegetables, ice, sauces, etc.  The object of this loan is to invest in supplying the store so that he can obtain a better income.  Samuel is thankful for the help from Kiva lenders who assist people with limited means and people from poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy items for resale in his grocery store like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, soap, juices, cookies, matches, vegetables, ice, sauces, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, wrapper, and brown sugar

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Phillip is a 31 year old businessman and construction contractor with Konjiko contractors. Nine years ago he built nine rental units in Kiambiu, where also lives with his two children and wife. 

At his plot, there are no toilets, his family and tenants have been using neighboring pit latrines where they pay for the services on a monthly basis. 

This year Philip along with one of his tenants have a plan to utilize the available space at their plot by establishing a kindergarten school. One of their worries is the lack of toilets at their premise and hence their interest in joining the Fresh Life Toilets Initiative.

By joining this movement, Philip hopes to simultaneously provide sanitation services to the children joining the school, his tenants and learn a lot about sanitatio, including how he can be more involved in overall sanitation improvement in his area. 

Let us help Philip acquire two Fresh Life Toilets!

loans.use: To pay for Two Fresh Life Toilets for use at a new kindergarten, thus providing healthy sanitary facilities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Maribel Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Maribel  pertenece al banco comunal "UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD" de la Asociación Arariwa. 
La socia sigue con su negocio de venta de anticuchos de forma ambulatoria, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de carne entre otros.
La socia  agradece a los inversionistas por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maribel belongs to the "UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD" communal bank at the Asociación Arariwa.

She continues in her business selling kebabs as a street vendor. She is a responsible and determined person who continues to sell to her clients on demand. She wants to continue to work in this manner so she can continue to support her family.

Maribel is requesting a loan to buy meat amongst others. She is grateful to the lenders for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy meat amongst others.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
This nice and very elegant woman’s name is Lilit and she lives with her parents and sister in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Lilit has two higher educations. In her native city Lilit works at the school as a teacher of geology. She mentions she likes her occupation and especially the subject that she teaches. 

She also says that to her happiness in the subject.  Lately more pupils are interested and among them are mainly boys. Lilit asks this loan as she wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature, as she greatly wants to bring more information connected with her subject for her pupils.  At her house she also can prepare some additional teams for her lessons to make it more interesting and attractive for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature in geology

loans.name: Levis

texts.en:
Levis is a 40 years old smallholder farmer from South Rift Kenya. He lives with his wife and children on a plot of land where he does dairy farming.  Levis' main source of income is milk. This year, he is looking to diversify his farm. 

Levis is seeking a loan to start commercial poultry farming.  He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chickens that are adapted to local conditions. He wants to take advantage of the growing demand for poultry products in the market. 

Levis will use the income that he hopes to earn from poultry farming to look after his family’s well-being and his children’s education. He also wants to continue investing in poultry to make it bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy poultry and expand his farming activity

loans.name: Young Women Learn To Do Business -N3Th3Đông Anh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hà has a retail business selling coal. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal to resell.

Hà is 25 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 'Young women learn to do business -N3th3Đông Anh' solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2012, Hà joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Hà has been involved in her business for 3 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 36, lives in a community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three children. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day. 

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. 

Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy noodles, seasoning, shampoo, soy sauce, canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal "Unión, Fuerza Amistad" de la Asociación Arariwa.
El socio sigue con su negocio de compra de carros usados para luego desarmarlos y después vender sus partes como chatarra en una feria sabatina, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de parabrisas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Unión, Fuerza Amistad" communal bank at the Asociación Arariwa.

He continues with his job of buying used cars to strip them and sell the parts as scrap metal at a Saturday market. He is a responsible and determined person and he wants to continue to work in this manner so he can continue to support his family.

Leoncio is requesting a loan to buy windshields amongst others.

loans.use: to buy windshields amongst others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercidita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling beauty products and buying and selling fruits.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mercidita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Muhammad’S Group

texts.en:
Muhammad and his group members are farmers by occupation. They are permanent residents of Lung, a remote village in district Gujranwala in Pakistan.

He and his group affiliates plant rice and wheat crops in a seasonal manner. The soil of the area is very fertile for rice crops, provided a right mix of agricultural inputs is utilized during and after cultivation. Unfortunately, the group members are very poor and do not have financing available to purchase the required quantity of fertilizers, fuel and pesticides. 

Therefore, they are looking for loan to finance their required agricultural inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticides, seeds and fuel. This loan will enable them to increase their farm productivity.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Luz Noemi

texts.es: Luz de 33 años de edad, vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y sus tres  hijos. Luz es una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día se esfuerza con el motivo de brindar a su familia todo lo necesario dentro del hogar, ella se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la elaboración de calzado en un taller el cual lo tiene instalado en su lugar de residencia y posteriormente ella lo distribuye su producto con los vecinos y entre los clientes que se ubican en el mercado más cercano de su comunidad. Luz con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y mejorar su vivienda ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en la compra de ladrillo para piso y tres puertas que le faltan a su casa y que son necesarias para poder brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her family, which includes her husband and their three children. She is a hardworking woman who puts forth effort every day with the goal of providing her family everything that they need for their household. For many years, she has made shoes in her home workshop. Later, she sells the products to her neighbors and customers that come to the closest market to her community.

Because she would like to improve her living conditions and her home, Luz has decided to request a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in bricks for flooring and three doors that she needs for her home. These things are necessary so that she can provide better security to her family.

loans.use: to purchase bricks for flooring and three doors that she needs for her home.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El socio Justo  pertenece al banco comunal “UNION FUERZA Y AMISTAD” de la Asociación Arariwa.
El socio sigue  con su negocio de  compra y venta de granos secos como trigo, habas y entre otros, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio continua vendiendo su mercadería sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de trigo entre otros.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member Justo belongs to the “UNION FUERZA Y AMISTAD” communal bank at the Asociación Arariwa.

He continues with his business selling dried grains like wheat and broad beans amongst others. He is a determined and responsible person. He continues to sell his merchandise to his clients when they request it as this is the way he gets his family ahead.

Justo is requesting a loan to buy wheat amongst others. He is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy wheat amongst others.

loans.name: Bunthorn

texts.en:
Bunthorn is 31 years old. He lives in the Posen Chey district of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He has been married since 2000. He has two sons and one daughter. The children are still young and have studied at primary school.

Bunthorn has been a tuk-tuk driver for six years, while his wife has been a staff member of an NGO for one year. Now he wants to increase his profit, so he applied for a loan to buy hens to raise.

loans.use: To buy hens to raise.

loans.name: Hard Working -N12Hậu Áng Group

texts.en:
Tú  lives in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling cake for more than 10 years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Tú  faces is lack of capital. 
In 2014, Tú  joined the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Tú  has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community. Tú   and 4 other women established the loan group "Hard working -N12Hậu áng" to get loans and share experience to improve business for a better life.
 She is requesting a loan to purchase food to process for sale.
With her business profit, Tú  hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase food to process for sale

loans.name: Edwin Obed

texts.es: Edwin de 34 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad. Edwin es una persona que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana a su vivienda y además posee un molino de moler maíz en su casa de habitación el cual le ayuda para poder mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera mantener la economía de su hogar. Edwin con el propósito de mejorar su casa y brindar a su familia una mejor condición de vida a tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para reparar el piso de la sala  y  la cocina de su vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado, con el monto otorgado invertirá en la compra de: arena, cemento y ladrillo de piso para mejorar de esta manera su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edwin is 34 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children, who are 10 and 3 years old. Edwin works providing security services to a local business, and also has a corn mill in his home, which helps him to improve his income and in this way maintain his household expenses. 

Edwin, with the aim of improving his home and giving his family better living conditions, has decided to apply for a loan from FUSAI to repair the floor of his living room and kitchen, which has deteriorated. With the amount he receives he will invest in the purchase of sand, cement and bricks for the floor so that he can improve his home.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and brick for his floor.

loans.name: Never Delinquent -N3Th6 Yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thoa is 32 years old and she is married. She has had a service business providing make-up sessions for four years. Thoa lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral, so she can't get loan from other banks or credit institutions.

The main hardship that Thoa faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for rent. This is Thoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Thoa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to rent

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia lives in Moalboal, Cebu with her family. She is 54 years old with two dependents, aged five and nine. 

Like most people her age, Emelia is into raising hogs. This business is easier to manage due to the proximity of the barns to the her home. This has been her business for 15 years. Every four months, she usually earns PHP 7000. In addition to this, she also sell supplements to the people in her community to earn additional income. 

She is asking a loan to buy piglets and feed for the hogs. This will assure her of healthy and fattened hogs that will give her a better return of investment. 

In the future, she hope to increase the number of hogs she has to raise. Her income will be for food and savings.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen seriously decided to develop his bee keeping activities in Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. Armen lives here happily, and as he likes to say, he never imagines even a single day without his native village and his bee keeping work. His father established the work and gave it to his son to continue and to make it larger. Now on his farm Armen has 50 bee families. 

The district Armen's father started his farm till today is famous of its very tasty, healing and pure honey. Armen has a lot of regular customers and he also takes orders of its sale beforehand. He also has plot of land on which he cultivates potatoes and uses them both for his family and to sell. 

Now with this Kiva partnership Armen has great hope of purchasing of some very important things for his bee families. 

Ashot is married and he has a son and daughter; both of them are school-aged. 

With this loan he wants to buy a lot of wax paper, frames and also several bee families for developing his farm.

loans.use: to buy a lot of wax paper, frames and also several bee families for developing his farm

loans.name: Naheed’S Group

texts.en:
Naheed and his group members are farmers by occupation. They are permanent residents of Harpoke, a far-flung village in district Gujranwala located in Pakistan.

He and his group members have a small land holding in the surrounding village where they cultivate wheat and rice annually. Both of these crops are the sole source of livelihood for the group members. Among other challenges faced by the farmers of his group, most prominent is the lack of funds to finance their agricultural inputs required to cultivate the rice crop. 

They are requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, improved quality of seeds, pesticides and fuel for their rice crop. This loan will help them to improve their yield and enable them to improve the living standard of their families.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Loch

texts.en: Loch is a 47-year-old resident with three children, who lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She earns some income from making snack foods to sell in her community and she has been in her business since 2005. Her husband is 44 years old and works as a construction worker in a nearby country. One of her three children is a goldsmith and two others are in school. Together, the family makes USD26 per day. Loch would like to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell, but she does not have sufficient finances. That’s why she has decided to request a loan. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy a cow and improve her family’s income when the cow is able to produce calves. In the future, she is going to expand her cow fattening, save money to build a new house and support her children's education through high school.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Lovely Group -N3Th5Quang Trung

texts.en:
Mrs Minh is 37 years old and she is married.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling meat for 8 years.
Minh lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable . 
The main hardship that Minh faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more beef to resell.
In 2014, Minh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Minh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more beef to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops, in order to get a better harvest for family use and a surplus to sell in the market.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 62 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct selling Personal Collection products in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Evangeline has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her direct sales business for 10 years. She also earns income from selling fish and farming plants.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Introducing you to Norah, a 26-year-old honest, hard-working and ever-smiling mother of one adorable child. She hails from Nkubu in Kenya, a banana-growing area where the staple food is “matoke”, a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from bananas.

Norah has been involved in farming for the past 3 years and she owns poultry that produce eggs for sale. When you visit her farm you will witness a variety of crops grown on her farm. Norah has a passion for farming. She is kindly requesting a loan to buy a cow and start a zero grazing unit. Through the zero grazing unit she will be assured of high milk production and she will be able to sell in both the local market and neighboring markets. The money that she will earn from the cow and the zero grazing unit will be reinvested back into the business to create growth.

Norah is a very ambitious mum and she projects that through the loan she will be able to permanently change her living conditions and secure the future of her child.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and start a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Naftal

texts.en:
Naftal is aged 53 years. He is married to Teresa and he supports 5 children. He has been offering tailoring services to clients for the last 6 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase tailoring materials such as fabrics, threads and buttons for making clothes to sell and hopes this will enable him to make more profits to support his family.

He plans to use the gained profit to educate his children. His future hopes are to expand his business, make more profit and eradicate poverty in his community.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials for making clothes to sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is 41 years old, and she lives in the city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. Arevik is married and she lives with her husband and two children.

Arevik graduated from Yerevan State University's faculty of mathematics. Since 1995, Arevik has worked at the local school as a teacher of informatics. 

Arevik asks for this Kiva loan because she needs to buy a new computer, accessories for it, and also some professional literature connected with her specialty.

loans.use: to buy a new computer, accessories for it, and also some professional literature connected with her specialty

loans.name: Alberto Ramon

texts.es:
Alberto en un pequeño productor de café en el departamento de Jinotega, Nicaragua. Actualmente cuenta con una manzana de café en su finca, y su visión es duplicar el área de este rubro de manera gradual, para lo cual está gestionando recursos que le permita realizar esta inversión y aprovechar las condiciones favorables que tiene su finca para la producción de este rubro. 
Para este año, él está solicitando un financiamiento para garantizar la mano de obra y la compra de insumos y materiales, que le permita tener bajo control las plagas y enfermedades en las áreas de café cosechero que tiene actualmente. 
Con la implementación de estas actividades, se logrará garantizar y mejorar la producción en el ciclo 2015-2016, y hacer frente a la inestabilidad en el mercado de café, lo cual ha venido enfrentando al estar certificado bajo el sello Fairtrade a través de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) a la cual está afiliado.
texts.en:
Alberto is a small coffee producer in Jinotega Department in Nicaragua. At present, he has 1.74 acres  planted in coffee on his farm, and his vision is to duplicate his area in coffee gradually. For that reason, alberto is seeking resources that will permit him to realize this investment and take advantage of current favorable conditions for coffee production on his farm.
 
For this year, Alberto is requesting financing that will guarantee the hiring of labor and purchase of inputs and materials to permit control of plant plagues and illnesses currently present in coffee producing areas.

With the implementation of these activities, Alberto will be able to assure and improve production during the 2015-16 cycle and confront the instability of the coffee market, which he must face in order to obtain certification under the Fair Trade label granted by the Association of People in Communitarian Action (PAC) with whom he is affiliated.

loans.use: to hire labor and purchase inputs and materials that will allow him to control coffee plant plagues.

loans.name: My First Loan -N4Th6Yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hạnh is 23 years old and she is married. Hạnh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral so she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions. 

She has had a service business, shipping goods, for three years.

The main hardship that Hạnh faces is a lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to maintain the bus to do transportation service.

This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She also wants for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to maintain the bus to do transportation service

loans.name: Poor But Fun - N11Th7Qgiao Group

texts.en:
Hằng is 35 years old and she is married.  She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Hằng lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village. Moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Hằng faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Solidarity Group- N11Minh Thắng

texts.en:
Thêm is 25 years old and is married. Her family is a low-income household in a village. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She lives in a region that often suffers natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.

She has had a service business repairing motorcycle for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thêm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment and motocycle parts to do motorcycle repair service. This is Thêm's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Thêm hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and motorcycle parts to do motorcycle repair services.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years of age. He is married to Franscisca and he supports two children. He has been offering computer services to clients for the last two years and the business earns him KES 4,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a computer and printer. This will enable him to offer more computer services to clients and increase his income and add more products for use in his business.

He plans to use his gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and also purchase chicks for rearing. His hope is to expand his business sectors and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and printer to enable him offer more computer services to clients and increasing his income to add more products for use in his business.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is 57 years old and he lives with his large family in Ddmashen village in the Gegharkunik region. Ashot lives with his wife, his son, his son’s wife and three grandchildren.

Ashot worked in different workshops as a worker. He is currently employed and at the same time he is running his farm. On the farm Ashot has cows, heifers, a calf, a pig, sheep and chickens. With the help of his wife, Ashot sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, curds, meat and eggs from his farm.

Ashot, and also his son, work very hard all day long to provide a better living for their family, especially for the children. So Ashot is requesting this loan of 700,000 AMD as he wants to buy two calves and also fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Sunset - N12Th7Qgiao Group

texts.en:
Hường is 55 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years.

Hường lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Hường faces is lack of capital.  

In 2001, Hường joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hường has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa micro-finance institution. She is a reputable person in the community. Hường  and four other women established the loan group "Sunset - N12Th7QGiao" to get loans and share experience to do business for a better life.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. With her business profit, Hường hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nyangau

texts.en:
Nyangau is aged 63 years, married to Catherine, and supports four children.He has been selling farm produce for the last one year and the business earns him KES 2,500 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable him supply milk to clients daily and meet both family and client needs.  

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and purchase chicks for keeping. His hope is to expand his agricultural sector and be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable him supply milk to clients daily and meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a poultry business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her poultry for her poultry business.

Evelyn has been in this business for nine years. Evelyn earns additional income from food vending and selling veterinary products on a retail basis. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, so she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her poultry

loans.name: Maa Saktimayi Shg-A Group

texts.en:
These members belong to the Maa Saktimayi SHG-A. One of them is Ashalata, age 45, (the lady standing first from the left in the red saree). She lives with her two children. She is a divorced lady. 

She alternates her daily activities with a business of selling rice, grams, spices, wafers, hair oil, and other household consumables. She runs a small shop where she sells all these things to support her family. She has been in this business for a good amount of time, and she does well, thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business. She also sells vegetables in her shop. 

With her group, she requested the loan, of which she will use her portion to buy sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents, and other household consumables for her business. She thanks those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled. The businesses of the other group members are butcher shop, dairy farm, and tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents, and other household consumables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, metal sheets, a toilet, etc.

loans.name: Lovely Farm -N06Thlý Đông Group

texts.en:
Nhung lives in the Nong Cong district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable. The main hardship that Nhung faces is lack of capital.  

In 2012, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nhung has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is a reputable person in the community. Nhung and four other women established the loan group "Lovely Farm -N06thLý Đông" to get a loan and share their experiences of doing business for a better life.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Lchashen village of the Gegharkunik region with her husband and three children. Their elder son now is in the army, and the smaller son and daughter are still school-aged. 

Marine has vocational medical education but she never worked in the medical sphere. She works now at the bread factory as a baker. 

Her husband is a farmer and he takes care of their farm cattle and cultivates some vegetables on their land. The income from their farm is the main one for the family. 

Unfortunately, this loan from Kiva, Marine needs not for farm development, but for the solution of her husband’s health problem. She asks for this loan as she is worried and she hopes that this loan will help to solve her husband’s health problem quickly.

loans.use: to solve her husband’s health problem

loans.name: Repay On Time Always -N03Th9Đôngminh Group

texts.en:
Vân works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Vân is 31 years old and she is married with one child.  She is the leader of a four-member group, the "Repay on time always -N03th9ĐôngMinh" solidarity group. She is a reputable person in the community.

Although this is Vân's  first loan with Thanh Hoa micro-finance institution, every member agreed to vote her to be the leader of "Repay on time always -N03th9ĐôngMinh" group. Vân has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Vân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Vân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Maa Saraswati Self Help Group-A is an exemplary group. They all are engaged in different activities to earn their livelihoods. All three members are engaged in different activity such as agriculture, grocery, and vegetable selling businesses. 

One person who deserves to be highlighted is Anila (the lady standing in the middle in the photo), a 25-year-old widow woman with no child, who is engaged in cultivating vegetables and selling them in the market. Through her job, she works to support her family, to improve her business, and to continue growing. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. She lives with her parents-in-law.

She is seeking part of this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other vegetables and fruits to continue to increase her sales. The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Grandmother Love Children -N11Th5Quảnggiao Group

texts.en:
Bạo is 59 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than ten years. Bạo lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Bạo faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. In 2011, Bạo joined Thanh Hoa micro-finance institution to improve her  business. Bạo has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa micro-finance institution.

With her business profit, Bạo hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Loan Help Me Much - N10Th9Đông Minh Group

texts.en:
Thuận has a retail business selling cake, sweets, sugar, and milk. He is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain the refreshment bar (small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks, and fast food).

Thuận is 30 years old and he is married with two children. Thuận is the group leader of the "Loan help me much - N10th9Đông Minh" solidarity group, which consists of four members. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns him is the lack of capital.

In 2014, Thuận joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve his  business. Thuận has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa micro-finance institution. Thuận has been involved in this business for five years.

In the future, Thuận hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
El socio Mateo vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
El socio sigue con su negocio de anticuchos de forma ambulatoria, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como carne entre otros.
El socio  agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
This member, Mateo, lives in the beautiful city of Cusco and belongs to the communal bank "Union, Fuerza, y Amistad" (Unity, Strength, and Friendship) of Asociación Arariwa. The member continues with his business selling anticuchos (grilled meat) as a street merchant. He has had this business for a long time, and he does well as a result of the hard work that he puts forth every day. He wishes to continue working so that he can continue supporting his family in this manner.

The member is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as meat, among other things. He gives thanks to the lenders for this loan, and he promises to make his payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as meat, among other things.

loans.name: Tariq’S Group

texts.en:
Tariq is a resident of a village called Qila Mustfa Abad located in Pakistan. He is standing in the group photo raising his hand and holding a register. He cultivates rice, wheat and vegetables to feed his family. 

He turned to the micro-finance institution Jinnah Welfare Society (JWS) to purchase improved seeds and farm inputs for increasing his farm's productivity. His wish is to be able to support himself through his business, and his plan is to construct a house for his family

He and his group members request a loan for input supplies. The profit made from selling rice will enable him to cover the family's expenses and to save money for the construction of new house.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs like fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya. Enock, 30, is a mixed farmer from Bomet, a rural town in Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for the past five years. This hardworking father of two earns his livelihood through selling milk, poultry, and crops, and though some personal business he engages in when harvests are low. 

He passionately loves poultry farming, and rearing chickens is his hobby. Every day he wakes up in the morning to collect eggs and feed his chickens, and he finds this very fulfilling. Neighbours have been flocking to his compound to buy eggs and through word of mouth, news has spread like fire in the whole village that he has quality eggs. 

The demand is so high, he cannot fully satisfy it. He is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan he will be able to satisfy the demand, and this will translate to increased income levels. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders, Enock believes that small-scale farmers like him will be able to benefit from financial solutions. Poultry meat is a very popular meal among many people in his village, and this translates to improved income and better living standards. 

Enock will sell eggs for commercial purposes and for home consumption. Increased income will allow Enock to provide nothing but the best for his family and improve his living conditions. Other than profits, he will benefit from poultry manure and poultry feathers, which will help improve his life.

Lend to this enterprising Kenyan farmer!

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Isabel De Los Dolores

texts.es: Isabel de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos dos mayores y uno menor de edad. Ella posee una tienda desde hace desde hace varios años  donde vende sopas, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, aceites, leches, etc., y con las ganancias de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Isabel con el deseo de reparar el techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones solicita un crédito a FUSAI  para la compra de lámina y pines para poder cambiar el techo de un cuarto dormitorio y el sector de la sala el cual en épocas de lluvia le presenta filtraciones de agua que dañan sus pertenencias materiales.
texts.en:
Isabel, 35 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and three children, two minors and one adult. She has had a store for many years where she sells soups, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, oils, milks, etc. With the earnings of her business she manages to pay some expenses of her home. 

Isabel, with the wish to repair the ceiling of her home which she finds in bad condition, is seeking a loan from FUSAI for the purchase of metal sheets and pins. [This will allow her] to be able to change the ceiling of a bedroom and the living room area which, during rainy seasons, have water leaks that damage their material belongings.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and pins to be able to change the ceiling of a bedroom and the living room area of her home.

loans.name: Leidy Paola

texts.es:
Paola es una muchacha con 20 años de edad, trabajadora y humilde, que desde hace poco inicio con su primer negocio, un almacén con gran variedad de productos.
De allí Paola ha logrado salir adelante y tener un buen avance como empresaria.

Debido a que no cuenta con un buen capital de trabajo solicita un crédito con el que comprara productos de la marca Amway, ya que sus clientes por calidad y economía lo prefieren.

Desea seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de continuar sus estudios universitarios, pues su mayor anhelo es ser toda una profesional.
texts.en:
Paola is a hardworking, humble, 20-year-old girl who started her own business recently. It is a general store with a wide variety of products, and it has enabled Paola to move ahead and make good progress as a businesswoman.

Since she does not have much money in savings, Paola is requesting a loan to buy Amway-brand products, which her customers prefer for their quality and affordability.

She wishes to keep working and fulfill her dream of continuing her university studies, since her greatest wish is to be a true professional.

loans.use: to buy Amway-brand products.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Damayanti is a 43-year-old lady. She is living in Odisha with her two children, who are schooling. Her husband was a farmer, and now he does not work as he met with an accident and lost his memory. For the past four years, Damayanti has been engaged in the activity of selling cow's milk in her village. Her son assists her in this activity.

Damayanti is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the leader of the group, Maa Tarini Shg-A. Both the members are involved in different activities like agriculture and a grocery shop.

Damayanti, along with her group, has requested a loan of 24,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed. Damayanti has a dream to provide a better living for her family. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed.

loans.name: Shree Jagatnath Shg-A Group

texts.en:
The responsible Shree Jagatnath SHG-A (self help group A) is made up of three members. The members of this group are all women from the district of Keonjhar in Odisha, India. One of them is Nandini, who was selected as their president. The lady standing first from the righthand side is Nandini. Nandini is 32-year-old, differently-able woman living with her husband and two children. She makes leaf plates and bowls woven out of dry leaves and sells them in the nearby market. These plates are used for different purposes, mainly for serving food. She makes different types and sizes of plates, depending upon the demand of her customers. She will use her part of the loan to purchase a machine so she can weave the plates more frequently and quickly and to purchase raw materials like leaves, thread, glue, and plastic. She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time. 

The other members of this group are engaged in different activities like milk selling, vegetable cultivation etc. All of the group members are very happy and thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like dry leaves, thread, glue and plastic, and a machine for weaving leaf plates.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar, from Vanadzor in the Lori region, likes very much her pleasant and profitable partnership with Kiva. This deal will be the third one for her.  

Gohar works at the Vanadzor Athletics and Winter Sports Center as the administrator/coach/teacher of the center. She has over 38 years of sporting experience. Gohar was awarded the Best Women's Coach of the Year by the European Association of Athletics. She is very much beloved and respected by all her pupils and collogues. Gohar is married and has a son who is also a sportsman. 

Gohar asks for this loan as she needs to buy sportswear and athletic shoes for herself and her son as well, since they must look proper and presentable at work, as they are coaches and examples for their pupils.

loans.use: to buy sportswear and sport shoes for herself and her son as well, since they must look proper and presentable as coaches

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is a taxi driver. He is a father of a newborn son and together with his lovely family lives in Goris town. Mher, as the only breadwinner in the family, has to work hard to sustain their living. He is a contractual worker in the army, and after his part-time work, he drives a taxi using his own car. The car is now damaged and Mher badly needs some funds to bring it to working condition and renovate it. That's the reason why Mher is asking for this loan.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Your help is very important for Mher and his taxi driving work, so he hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for car renovation to be able to drive it as a taxi and earn income for his young family

loans.name: Sanasar

texts.en:
Sanasar is an auto repairman who lives in Akhuryan village with his lovely family. Sanasar is a father of three children. In the yard of his house, Sanasar provides auto repair service for local people living in nearby villages and towns. He is skilled, experienced and responsible in his work, so there are many clients waiting for Sanasar's service currently. He has applied for this loan to purchase working tools needed for his auto repair service. The tools which he currently owns are damaged and old, so it is very important for Sanasar to receive your support and improve the quality of the work he provides. 

Sanasar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. He hopes to receive lenders' support and develop his small business so his beloved family has better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for working tools needed for auto repair service

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
Promise is a group consisting of five members and led by Getrude (who is standing second from the left), a 49-year-old woman, married to Clement, a 58-year-old man. They have three children.

Every morning Getrude buys wax-prints, lace, and kente cloth (African fabric) directly from the main market at a lower price and sells them at another market. Getrude usually operates the business from 7 am to 4 pm every day.

In order to make more income she has planned to buy and sell more wax-prints, lace and kente (African fabric). To make her plan come true, she needs more money. This is her 10th loan cycle with ID-Ghana and the third with Kiva. 

She has four other colleagues who are dealing in maize porridge, second-hand clothing, cooked rice and beans, and grocery and foodstuffs. They are requesting a loan totaling GHS 9,700 to boost their businesses. They hope Kiva/ID-Ghana will support them so that they can better their businesses.

loans.use: to buy and sell wax-prints, lace and kente cloth (African fabric) to customers.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
For ten years, Tigran has been running a grocery store. He rents a shop in one of the busy parts of the village, Akhuryan, in Shirak region. He works with various grocery distributors on credit sales. As his clients' demands are growing each day, Tigran is willing to increase the assortment of goods in the shop.  

Tigran is a father of four sons. His wife takes care of them and also runs a family-based farming business near their house. 

Tigran has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Tigran hopes to receive lenders' support and develop his food-selling business, so his family has better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of food, drinks, chocolate, and candies for the store.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia es una señora de 38 años de edad, que desde hace poco logro montar su propio negocio, una salsamentaría, la cual le genera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de surtido, pintura para el local, una nevera y un equipo el cual le ayude ambientar el lugar de una mejor manera.

Sus sueños son muchos, pero el principal es seguir trabajando para comprar una vivienda propia, ya que con esta su estabilidad económica mejoraría y le brindaría una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

Con su ayuda esta mujer podrá alcanzar lo deseado, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Ofelia is a lady of 38 years old, who recently managed to set up her own business, a delicatessen, which generates the income necessary to meet the needs that her household deserves.

She is applying for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of stock, paint for the business site, a refrigerator, and a team to help her fix the place up.

Her dreams are many, but the main one is to continue working to buy her own home, since with this her economic stability would improve and provide a better quality of life for her son. 

With your help this woman can achieve what she wishes for; take heart, make a loan.

loans.use: buy stock, paint for the business site, a refrigerator and a team to help her fix the place up.

loans.name: Maria Fanny

texts.es:
A sus 69 años la señora Fanny, logro montar su propio negocio, una sala de belleza, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante luego del fallecimiento de su esposo quien era el sostén del hogar.
Trabaja todos los días entre 5 y 7 horas.

Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de una vitrina, productos como tinturas, tratamientos, cremas y otros, pero principalmente adecuara el local conforme a la disposición de la ley, para obtener las licencias pertinentes.

Su mayor sueño es tener su negocio formalizado y en un futuro dejárselo a sus hijas, pues son el motivo de esta mujer seguir luchando.

Aporte a la vida de esta señora, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
At age 69, Maria Fanny managed to start her own beauty salon business. A way in which she was able to move forward following the death of her husband, who was the breadwinner of the household. She works for five to seven hours each day.

She is currently requesting a loan which she will use to buy a display case and products such as dyes, treatments, creams, and other things. She will first convert the premises in accordance with the laws, so she can obtain the appropriate permits.

Her biggest dream is to formalize her business and in the future, give it to her daughters, as they are the reason she continues to strive.

Contribute to this woman's life, by making a loan.

loans.use: to buy a display case and products such as dyes and treatments. She will also convert the premises in accordance with the laws, so she can obtain the appropriate permits.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.es:
Oliva es una madre de 64 años de edad, emprendedora y dinámica. 
Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de restaurante, así ha logrado solventar los gastos familiares y personales durante 6 años que lleva funcionando su negocio. 

El crédito que solicita estará destinado para la ampliación y remodelación de su restaurante, ya que tiene un contrato para alimentar  gran cantidad de trabajadores de obra que llegaran a su negocio para comer, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y ofrecer sus alimentos de una mejor manera, abriendo paso para un mejoramiento en las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe. 

Oliva, con su espíritu de superación y su proyección hacia la consecución de sus objetivos, se traza la meta de ampliar su negocio, para tener la capacidad de atender a mayor cantidad de clientes, mejorando así la rentabilidad del establecimiento para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olivia is a 64 year old mother. She is an entrepreneur and a dynamic woman.  With the intention of generating income to contribute to the finances of the family, she decided to start her own restaurant. This is how she has been able to cover the family and personal expenses during the 6 years that she has been in business. 

The loan she request is to expand and remodel her restaurant. She has a contract to feed a large number of workers that come to her business to eat.  This will allow her to continue with her work and to offer her meals in a better way. It will give her the opportunity to improve her sales and therefore, the income she receives.

Olivia, with her spirit of improving and her impulse to reach her objectives has set the goal of expanding her business in order to have the capacity to server a greater number of customers. This will improve the profitability of her establishment and give her a better quality of life.

loans.use: to expand and remodel her restaurant since she has a contract to feed a large quantity of workers.

loans.name: Fanaka Kajiungeni Group

texts.en:
Ossy is a father of five kids: four boys and one girl. He is 46 years old and married. He has been a tailor and has been making clothes for 19 years now and is able to make a good profit each month. He starts working at 7:00 a.m. and works until 8:00 p.m. daily.

This is his 26th credit from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy materials for making clothes. He dreams to own a big business. He will share this loan with his loan group "Fanaka Kajiungeni," which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Araqsi

texts.en:
Araqsi and her husband are experienced and skilled farmers from Dalarik village of Armavir region. On their farm, Araqsi and her husband Vahram keep livestock (20 calves and 70 hens) and also cultivate crops. Besides agriculture, Araqsi also works in a local kindergarten as a teacher, which brings not big, but nevertheless some income to her family.

Aiming to improve her farm, Araqsi now asks for this loan to purchase five oxen and pay salaries to laborers whom she hired for farming work.

This is Araqsi's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she previously got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to pay back, and Araqsi faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her mother were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments.

So, Araqsi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Please support Araqsi and her husband with this loan and help them to sustain their farm.

loans.use: to pay for five oxen and pay salaries to workers for farming work.

loans.name: Carita Feliz Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario carita feliz está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, coordinado por Cinthya una mujer laboriosa de 25 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos por quienes trabaja día a día para sacarlos adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace ocho años, una de sus metas es hacer crecer el negocio, por lo que solicita por octavo ciclo el financiamiento en ADIM, para comprar pantalones,camisetas, blusas y chores. La segunda socia es Martha de 33 años quien es estilista y la tercer socia es Blanca de 36 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Carita Feliz" (Happy Face) is composed of three entrepreneurial women. The coordinator of the group is Cinthya, a hard-working, 25-year-old woman. She is married, and she is the mother of three children, for whom she works day after day so that they can move forward. For the past eight years, she has made a living selling new clothing.

One of her goals is expanding her business. For this reason, she is requesting her eight cycle loan from ADIM to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and shorts. The second member is Martha, who is 33 years old and works as a stylist. The third member is Blanca, who is 36 years old and works selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and shorts.

loans.name: Loan Change My Life -N9Th4Đông Minh Group

texts.en:
Hiền is applying for a loan to purchase medicine to resell. She has a retail business selling medication. Hiền has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hiền is 34 years old and married with two children. Hiền is the group leader of the “Loan change my life - N9th4Đông Minh" solidarity group, which consists of eight members.

In 2014, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community. Hiền and seven other women established the loan group "Loan change my life - N9th4Đông Minh" to get a loan and share the experience to do business for a better life.

In the future, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer con 40 años de edad, soltera y con dos hijos de 17 y 24 años de edad, desde hace poco monto su propio negocio, una tienda la cual ubico en la sala de la casa donde reside.
Este ha sido un medio por el cual la señora Sandra ha tenido un gran avance, pues es de allí donde logra obtener los ingresos suficientes para su sostenimiento.

Actualmente no cuenta con muchos productos, es por esto que solicita un crédito con el fin de abastecer su negocio con productos de la canasta familiar como huevos, arroz, bebidas y snack.

Quiere seguir trabajando y luchando por cumplir el sueño de comprar una vivienda propia, sabe que de la mano de los colaboradores del portal Kiva lo lograra.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 40-year-old woman who is single with two children, ages 17 and 24. Not long ago, she started her own business, which is a store located in a room in the home where she lives.

This is how Sandra has advanced greatly, as this is how she makes enough income to support herself.

Currently, she does not have many products, which is why she is requesting a loan in order to stock her store with everyday products such as eggs, rice, beverages and snacks.

She wants to continue working and striving to fulfill her dream of buying her own home. She knows that with help from the Kiva partners, she will achieve this dream.

loans.use: to stock her business with everyday products such as eggs, rice, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Happy Group -N6Thbắcqnham

texts.en:
Mrs. Bế is 38 years old and married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than ten years. Bế lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her income is lower than the national average income; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Bế faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

In 2006, Bế joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Bế has successfully repaid nine loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Bế hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for her pig

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered milk, powdered juice, laundry soap, chips, coffee, shampoo and bath soap

loans.name: Antonio José

texts.es: Para José el desempleo se convirtió en una oportunidad de iniciar su propio negocio, este emprendedor hombre reside de un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, en donde aperturó una ferretería al considerar que en este sector, su negocio sería muy transcurridos por los habitantes y transeúntes del sector, así fue y gracias a su dedicación, carisma y buen servicio, cuenta con ocho año de funcionamiento y aunque las faltas de financiamiento le han limitado las posibilidades de ampliación y crecimiento, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en materiales para la construcción de mucha rotación.  Con esta inversión pretende renovar el surtido y dinamizar sus ventas.   Su meta a futuro es abrir otra sucursal y continuar ofreciéndole bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: Jose’s turned his unemployment into an opportunity for starting his own business.  This entrepreneur lives in a neighborhood in the town of Soledad, where he opened a hardware store, considering that this area is well travelled by the local people and transients in the area.  Thanks to his dedication, charisma, and good service, he has been in business for eight years even though his lack of finances has limited his expansion and growth.  He is asking for a Kiva loan, which will be his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy good selling building materials.  He expects to renew his stock and diversify his sales with this investment.  His goal is to open another branch and continue caring for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto es uno de los pocos hombres que se esmera y cuida la naturaleza, porque gracias a ello obtiene sus ingresos, él cuenta que con el apoyo que ha recibido de ADICLA Y KIVA ha logrado superase, es por ello que ahora solicita un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y abono orgánico para sembrar en esta temporada unas cuerdas de zanahoria, pues este cultivo es su mayor fuente de ingresos, es por ello que guarda las esperanzas de contar otra vez con el crédito y seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Gilberto is one of the few men who take great pains to care for nature and that is how he makes an income. He has received help from ADICLA and Kiva and has been able to get ahead.

This is why he is now requesting a new loan that he will invest in the purchase of seeds and organic fertilizer to plant a few cuerdas [about one acre each] of carrots this season. This crop is his greatest source of income. This is why he is hopeful that he will get another loan and continue prospering.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Berny Evenor

texts.es:
Berny es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 2 manzanas en las cuales tiene sembrado café. En los últimos años,  este productor ha logrado cosechar aproximadamente 90 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación Fairtrade.

Este pequeño productor ha venido mejorando su finca y como parte de este plan los resultados van siendo mejores cada año, en cuanto a productividad y calidad de su producto.

Uno de los mayores retos que enfrenta este productor en su finca es el control de las plagas y enfermedades del café, tales como la antracnosis la cual provoca manchas en las hojas y frutos.  Para garantizar un plan de manejo integrado de plagas y enfermedades en sus plantaciones, Berny está solicitando para este ciclo un financiamiento que le permita la adquisición de insumos y fertilizantes para el manejo agronómico del café, a fin de incrementar la producción de café. Todo esto derivará en mejores ingresos para alcanzar la sostenibilidad y reinversión en su finca.
texts.en:
Berny is a producer from the north of Nicaragua. His farm is 2 manzanas (1 manzana = 1.74 acres) and he grows coffee. In the last few years, this producer has managed to harvest approximately 90 quintals of  “pergamino”  (parchment) coffee, which he produces following the Fairtrade certification guidelines. This small producer has been improving his farm and as part of that plan the results have been better each year in terms of productivity and product quality. One of the main challenges this producer faces on his farm is pest control and coffee plant diseases, such as “antracnosis” (a fungal plant disease) that causes spots on the leaves and beans. 

To guarantee a maintenance plan for pests and disease control on his farm, Berny is requesting a loan for this cycle. The loan will allow him to acquire the supplies and fertilizers for the agronomic handling of the coffee in order to increase the coffee production. This will result in better earnings to sustain and to reinvest in his farm.

loans.use: to guarantee a maintenance plan for pests and disease control on his farm.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal FE Y Esperanza está conformada por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres de familia responsables de quince hijos, todos menores de edad, los cuales están estudiando, son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que se caracteriza por la producción de leche,  se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día  a día para sacar adelante a sus hijos, y sus negocios.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Rosa Emilia y tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos en  pie, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace cinco años que se desempeña en dicha actividad, ella dedica a su negocio unas ochos horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de un lote de cerdos en pie para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comunal Fe y Esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal association FE Y Esperanza is made up of 9 members, including 9 women and one man. Mothers and fathers who are responsible for 15 children, all of whom are minors and are studying.

They originate from Malpaisillo, a place known for its milk production. The people are known for being hard-working, responsible and have the desire to better themselves. Unfortunately they could not study and they had to work in order to help with the costs of the home. At the moment, they struggle every day to help their children, and their businesses move forward. 

Thanks to her desire to move forward the coordinator is Rosa Emilia. Her economic income comes from raising and selling live pigs, the business has been run from a room in her house for 5 years, since she set up the business. She dedicated 8 hours of every day to her business, selling her products. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in buying an auction lot of live pigs so that in the near future she will be able to obtain more earning. 

The communal association Fe y Esperanza is thankful for the help which the Kiva investors have offered to people of little resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, to have decent daily work.

loans.use: to purchase an auction lot of pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy himself a precision seeder

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is 33 years old and he lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Aram now works at the gas station and simultaneously at the nearby village.  Kaghnut he has a nice farm where is engaged in pig breeding. Here he has pigs and piglets, a cow, a donkey and chickens. He has a lot of customers who regularly buy his farm products such as pork, milk and eggs. All these cattle he keeps in a barn built be him. 

Aram is married and he has two children. His wife is unemployed and very skillfully helps her husband in farming activities. Aram asks a loan of 300.000 Armenian Dram as he needs to buy fodder for his pigs and piglets, in order to keep them in a good state for sale.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his pigs and piglets, in order to keep them in a good state for sale

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 47 years old, married and supports a family of 6 children.  He has been operating in his retail shop for the last 28 years earning KES 15,000 per month.

Kennedy has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain. 
He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Maombi (shown in center) is a member from Umoja Ni Nguvu group, she lives in Democratic Republic of Congo in the city of Uvira. She 40 years old is currently married with seven children. Four children currently attending school.

Maombi works very hard to provide for them. She is asking for this new loan through Wezesha Project to purchase additional merchandise to sell, currently she need to invest in her business. Buying larger quantities of beans and maise in order to generate more sales. 

All five in their group finished the last loan on time and their incomes helped in differences ways for their family, they are all thankful.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize for sale

loans.name: Eversharp Group

texts.en:
Gaudancia is a member of Eversharp group. The group is based in Glen View Harare. She is a married mother of six school going children, her husband is unemployed and she is working hard to support the family, sending her children to school. 

Gaudancia and her other group members joined Thrive in April 2015 and they received business advice. They are very appreciative for the business advice they received from Thrive and wishes to maintain a good relationship with Thrive and its partners so as to continue benefiting from its program.
Gaudencia has a general shop business in their community, selling groceries. They have applied for a combined loan of $1370 and she wants to use her portion of the loan amount to restock more groceries from South Africa and sell at her shop. 

Gaudencia is a hard working woman and said she is planning to open a shop in their community when she have enough capital to do so. She is very happy that she opened a savings account which she wants to use to make some savings for her to open a shop in the future.

loans.use: To expand her grocery business.

loans.name: Panales No 2 Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal  Panales No2 está conformada por ocho mujeres, madres solteras con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad, ellas son originarias del  Sauce, y se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, en la actualidad luchan para sacar adelante sus negocio el cual es su mayor desafíos por la competencia, pero a pesar de esos han crecido poco a poco, aumentando su clientela, y sus productos.
Gracias a sus ganas de Salir adelante la coordinadora es Mirla y tiene por actividad económica una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, desde hace cinco años que se desempeña en dicha actividad, la cual realiza con mucha dedicación ya que la fuente de ingresos de sus familias. Ella dedica unas doce horas diarias a su negocio para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, jugos, gaseosas, fósforos, harina, verduras, tiste,  hielo, dulces, meneítos, etc. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comunal  Panales No 2 agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “Panales No 2” communal bank is formed by 8 women who are single mothers with 10 children under their care. They are natives of El Sauce and they are known for working hard, being responsible and wanting to get ahead. They like to spend their free time with their children. Unfortunately, they could not attend school due to the lack of financial resources. Currently, they are struggling to get their business ahead. Their main challenge is the competition.
